characters: BOBBY STOPS. FEET CRUSHING THE TWIGS... A GUNSHOT, FROM
SEVERAL COPS BREAK FLARES, ROLLING THEM INTO THE WEEDS.
JOSEPH, DUCKED BEHIND THE CAR SEAT AND COVERED WITH GLASS
A PAIR OF SMOKESTACKS AGAINST AN ORANGE AUTUMN SUN SKY...
BACK TO THE POLICE STATION HALLWAY
INTO BOBBY, WITH THE FIGURE BEHIND HIM. BOBBY SEES THE
DETERMINATION, HE THROWS HIMSELF OUT A NEARBY WINDOW.
NO ONE FREEZES. CHAOS. GUNFIRE. PAVEL SWINGS BACK TO
AN ANNOUNCEMENT BOARD, SURROUNDED BY FLOWER
BULLETS COMING FROM EVERYWHERE. ABOVE AND BELOW.
FIGURES, OBSCURED BY THE WEEDS, APPEAR AND DISAPPEAR LIKE
BOBBY EMERGES FROM THE FIRE... HE WALKS TOWARD THE PO
TOWARD THEM, SLAMMING INTO PASSENGER'S SIDE. EXPLOSIVE. A
A VAN CROSSES THE LINE OF ONCOMING TRAFFIC. COMES RIGHT
A GUST OF WIND PASSES--REVEALING--A SILHOUETTED FIGURE,
THE COPS ARE FORCED TO ENGAGE IN A FURIOUS GUN BATTLE, TH
COMES SPINNING AT INCREDIBLE SPEED. AT BOBBY'S WINDSHIELD
BOBBY IS CAUGHT IN THE MIDDLE. STILL STRUGGLING WITH
BODY RIDDLED WITH SHARDS OF GLASS.
HE SEES HIS CHANCE. HE CHARGES BACKWARD. WITH FEROCIOUS
ANOTHER CAR PULLS IN BETWEEN THEM. AUTOMATIC WEAPONS FIRE
SUBJECTIVE WAY, WITH THE EMPHASIS ON WITNESSING THE ACTIO
WITH HIS ARM RAISED, POINTING, RIGHT AT BOBBY.
SUPERIMPOSE ON THE SCREEN'S LEFT SIDE
PASSENGER'S SEAT FLIES RIGHT THROUGH THE FRONT WINDSHIELD
VADIM SCURRIES INTO THE WEEDS... THE SMALL STRUCTURE
THUNDERING SOUND, GLASS EVERYWHERE. THE COP IN THE
CHANNEL TWO NEWS ANCHORWOMAN MICHELLE MARSH
STARTS TUMBLING, NOT ON ITS SIDE, BUT HEAD OVER TAIL.
BOBBY'S HEARTBEAT THUMPS ON THE SOUNDTRACK... A MAN
POLICE CARS, SIRENS BLAZING, JOIN THE PURSUIT...
SIGHT OF NEZHINSKI AS BOBBY WAITS. AT LAST, HE DECIDES TO
SEEMS LIKE WE CAN LITERALLY HEAR THE BLOOD RUSHING THROUG
WHERE, GOD ONLY KNOWS... A RUSH OF IMAGES--SHADOWED

dialogues.speaker: A PAIR OF SMOKESTACKS AGAINST AN ORANGE AUTUMN SUN SKY...
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA ZOOMS OUT to REVEAL: A CEMETERY in the foreground. TOMBSTONES blend into a NEVER-ENDING SEA OF MIDDLE-CLASS ROW HOUSES in the distance, and nothing seem to separate the two. A NEWLY DUG GRAVE is in the LOWER LEFT-HAND CORNER of our FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILITARY DRUMS. HUNDREDS of POLICEMEN, in their DRESS BLUES, ENTER from FRAME RIGHT. A FEW COPS CARRY a COFFIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York, New York.   1988.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new breed of narcotics has swept the great city, bringi with it a ferocious crime wave more terrifying than any i recent memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old criminal order is gone. In its place, new ethnic groups rise up to seize control without respect for traditional rules of engagement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outmanned and outgunned, demoralized by cutbacks and scandal, the Police find themselves burying one of their own at the rate of twice a month...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WORDS TURN BLOOD RED, then DISAPPEAR. The POLICE LOWE THE COFFIN when they arrive at the SITE. As we begin to ZOOM INTO a CLOSE ANGLE ON THEM, we HEAR MUSIC. A THUMPIN POP BEAT. THE CLASH'S "ROCK THE CASBAH"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: BOBBY GREEN, thirty. He is passionate and vital and handsome, a real physical presence. His CLOTHES are stylish, expensive. A sly SMILE. He steps forward, into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera MOVES with him to SEE: ROSARIO DIAZ, twenties, dark-skinned, impossibly gorgeous. Leaning up against the wall, biting her lower lip, eyeing Bobby with true desire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you're so fuckin' beautiful, you know that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She beams. They kiss, PASSIONATELY. SUPERIMPOSE: "BROOKLYN". They really GO AT IT. They are ferocious; as they DEVOUR each other:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we HEAR a fist BANGING ON A DOOR, a MUFFLED VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby!   You in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ANSWER--they're too busy making out. Then, MORE BANGING. They both START LAUGHING. The voice continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby! [If] you two could just keep your hands off each other for a second--I, I think we got a situation brewin' out front!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jumbo... We gotta go anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; to the door) I'll be out in a second, Louis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs him; he moves back in, starts MAULING her again She SLIDES DOWN his body, perhaps to perform fellatio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge, bustling, vibrant nightclub, very `80's. Decadent pure New York. BOBBY emerges from the back room area, straightening out his outfit. ROSARIO is behind him, fixing herself and walking toward the front of the club. Bobby enters the PULSING, VITAL HEART of the place. As he appears, everyone approaches, happily shouting out his name. He is having a blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is the master of this domain. An `80's version of Tony Manero from SATURDAY NIGHT FEVER, but without kitsch He is genuine cool. MUSIC: BLONDIE'S "HEART OF GLASS." Bobby waves hello to people, greets them ("Hey, baby!"), pretty girl kisses him (the women love him). Moves with a swagger, a DANCE. As he sways, he re-buttons his shirt, claps his hands. He is the CLUB MANAGER, and HE LOVES every minute of it. He's GIDDY, ALIVE, a PERMANENT GRIN. WE WANT HIS LIFE. SENSUOUS, SEDUCTIVE, INCREDIBLE FUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN waves to BOBBY. Bobby SEES: seated at a table, surrounded by his gang: VADIM NEZHINSKI. Thirty-five, acn scarred, huge black pompadour, big gut. One of his men, PAVEL LUBYARSKY, is next to him. Bobby nods back to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario meets up with several of her girlfriends, and we SEE an OPERATION at work: people come get their coats, slide the coat check girls a HUNDRED BUCKS, and with thei coats the patrons get JUNK put in their jacket pockets. Rosario looks to one of her girls--ALINA, a young Russian with too much makeup--and counts the cash. Pockets some o it. From Rosario's BEHAVIOR, we SEE she's INVOLVED in the DRUG TRADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE FIGHT that's breaking out. Violent. Club patrons and SECURITY GUYS are in the melee. Girls SCREAM. ROSARIO moves past all this, to the front door. LOUIS FALSETTI, forty, backs off from the multiple struggles all around him. Louis is wearing a jacket that says "SECURITY" on it He is the jocular type, very overweight, redfaced. Bobby arrives at the fight scene. With cheery braggadocio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck's goin' on in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby moves RIGHT IN. Grabs a struggling and drunk PATRON puts him in a headlock. He gives the Patron a SHOT TO THE TEMPLE, just to keep him docile. Lou, Bobby's best friend watches the imbroglio with an amused and cowardly detachment, CHORTLING with every punch and scream. He balances a drink in his hand with marvelous care, avoidin spillage. But the BATTLE GETS CLOSER AND CLOSER. Seeing his friend Bobby, who's hardly got everything in control:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Bobkes! Looks like you got everything under control here--so uh, so I'm gonna go outside, take my break!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--just keep that wide load of yours outta trouble, arright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your fuckin' majesty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Patron is acting up again, trying to free himself fro Bobby's grip. Bobby looks down at him. With humor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?!? You gotta behave yourself here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gives the guy a shot in the head. Meanwhile: LOUIS saunters past the melee, jumping gracefully over a fallen drunk. He BOWS in triumph when others applaud his leap. Everyone laughs as he goes out the door. Bouncer FREDDIE helps clean up the mess. A GIRL SCREAMS as a GUY is flipped on his back by bouncers. A PATRON with BLOOD ON HIS FACE, acting like an eight year-old, to Bobby (who hurls his guy out of frame):

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Mr. Green! I didn't do nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now you're gonna do nothing someplace else! (louder, to all fighters; pointing:) Now listen--one of these days I'm gonna run this whole block, and I see any you in here again--any you-- I'll bust your fuckin' hole! (to Freddie) Throw `em out on their ass. I gotta go upstairs, drop off my keys with the old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wood-panelled walls. Bobby walks upstairs, fixing his hai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ornate, gaudy place. The walls are covered by mirrors with that cheesy brown marble pattern print all over them Plush couches, clutter. Bobby walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR RADIO MUSIC up here, nothing like the stuff playe downstairs. A RUSSIAN CROONER. In an EASY CHAIR sits MARAT BUZHAYEV (pronounced BOO-SHY'-EV). He is old, kindly, weakened by age; sits next to his babushka wife, KALINA. Buzhayev watches a Russian musical program with the sound off, listening to his small transistor radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby!   Come here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Buzhayev, how are you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby leans over, hugs the seated old man. The two EMBRAC WARMLY--they are close. Before separating, Buzhayev touches his face. KALINA yells happily in RUSSIAN, grabs BOBBY, embraces him too. She couldn't be more motherly, amd Bobby BEAMS at the treatment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So beautiful!   Beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is moved, almost embarrassed by the loving attentio Then, gently dropping a set of KEYS on a side table:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Mr. Buzhayev--I gotta go do something right now. But don't worry--everything's in good shape downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warm, gentle) Yes, good. You take care of things good for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat smiles.    Then, as Bobby stands:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week, you come by--we talk. Okay? We talk about plans for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby lights up, nods. Marat pats his cheek. Kalina tries to give him a small care package of food. He politely refuses, and a minor and friendly AD-LIBBED argument in Russian ("He said he didn't want any food, and you keep trying to give it to him!") breaks out between the old husband and his wife. As Bobby exits:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (broken English) Bobby! Where you run off to?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modern church. A big crowd in front, made up of POLICE. We HEAR MUSIC. CLOSE SHOT of a black outdoor sign, behind glass. "OUR LADY, QUEEN OF MARTYRS CHURCH, QUEENS, NY". TILT DOWN: WHITE PRESS-ON letters CROOKEDLY spelling out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC explodes down here. A large room with columns. Streamers, balloons everywhere. Old cops, young cops, men women, are here. Skinny, portly, giddy, drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many are IN UNIFORM, loosened up a bit, like they've just gotten off work and it's time to relax. Children run about. American, New York State flags. Pictures on the walls: people with plaques, portraits. ARCHIE BUNKER'S NE

dialogues.speaker: YORK. A SIGN READS
dialogues.text: GRUSINSKY'". Cases filled with trophies. Food tables, piled high. And beer. Lots and lots of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many COPS are drinking, cavorting, smoking CIGARS, making sandwiches. And DANCING UP A STORM. Men and women FLIRT, GAB, MAKE OUT. FLASH! Pictures taken constantly. A mass of people surround TWO PEOPLE as a PHOTO is taken:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: JOSEPH GRUSINSKY, thirties. Bobby's OLDER BROTHER. In uniform. Clean-cut, though not neurotically so. Sharp, tough features--the GLOW of a WINNER. He is SMILING, receiving many AD-LIBBED CONGRATULATIONS and holding one of his children in his arms, infant PAUL. Nex to him is his wife, SANDRA, thirties. Next to her, their older infant, TEDDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEXT TO JOSEPH: BURT GRUSINSKY, sixty. Bobby's father, we will soon learn. Tough as nails. Unsentimental, ex- military, rough-edged, vital. In this world, he is a king

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing behind Burt are his two closest associates: MICHAEL SOLO ("G.Q."), fifties, somewhat urbane, and JACK SHAPIRO ("Pudge"), also fifties. A big, quiet man. Huge hands. The enforcer. Burt is beaming over his treasured son. He directs a PHOTOGRAPHER, repositions Joseph:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, take another one! Get another!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop, they got enough! What're you doin'?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Joseph's ear) You want your face out there--it's good exposure. The PC's gonna see this. (to the Photographer) C'mon. With both kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Chief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt waves to the Photographer, then leans again into Joseph's ear. Still wearing a smile for the outside world

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see your brother yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head; then) He ain't gonna come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowns; then:) He better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLOSEUP of ROSARIO.    Beat.   Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. What's the big deal anyway? We'll go in, you say hello, then we'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby seems reluctant.   Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember what I tol' you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!   Course!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows about my father and my brother--not even Jumbo. And it's gotta stay that way, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you tol' me a thousand times. But I been with you for two years, Bobby--I should meet `em by now. We goin' in or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON BOBBY as we go to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE past partygoers. THEN, APPEARING AT THE TOP OF TH STEPS: Bobby and Rosario--who's being eyed up and down salaciously by the men in the party. The two start to com down the narrow stairs leading to the basement. A portly, ebullient man, RUSSELL DE KEIFER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby? Bobby Grusinsky, that you? How you doin'?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, Russell De Keifer, from across Northern Boulevard, remember? You still bartending that Russian joint, out there in Brooklyn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.   Nah, I'm managing now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, big shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'll see you `round, arright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby slinks past De Keifer.     Rosario touches his arm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly sheepish) I changed my name--I use my mother's name now. It's better for business. C'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wiry YOUNG POLICE REPORTER, in uniform, moves to Joseph Burt stands nearby, proud:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Grusinsky, hi! I'm Officer Timpanaro from SPRING 3100, the police magazine--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reporter reads his question off a small pad.      (VE important that he come off like an amateur.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So: um, you are now the third--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone hits his arm.     He drops his pad, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third youngest captain on the Force, and our P.B.A. readers'll wanna know just how that, um-- (looks at his pad) --Feels!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels like nothin'. Nah, it feels good! I love trying to, you know, help make the City safer for people and everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Rosario come down the stairs. Bobby immediately SEES his family, though they don't see him yet. To Rosario, quiet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's them there. In the corner. Lookit `em--two peas in a pod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--I see `em! They don't look that bad though, you know? For cops? (re: Michael, Jack) Who're those other guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [My] Father's friends--they were all in Korea together. (with a laugh) Biggest bunch of fuckin' stiffs... (moves closer) Look, don't talk to nobody, we'll get out quicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; darkening) I ain't gonna embarrass you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N--I just wanna get out quick, that's all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby approaches, looks over to Sandra. The two nod an AWKWARD HELLO. Then the two brothers meet. We SEE the relationship between them. Strained, but a warmth deep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, hey! You, you got off work and everything--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I did so...congratulations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMULTANEOUS: Burt motions to JACK, MICHAEL.      The two UPSTAIRS. Burt steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop. (Rosario moves near) Everybody, this is my girlfriend. Rosario.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This's my brother. And my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Joseph take one look at her and respond with subdued "hellos." She is not exactly, well, PROPER- LOOKING. And she isn't white. She picks up on this, tries to act as though she doesn't care. Burt turns to Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta talk to you. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON BOBBY. This gives him pause, but Rosario gives him a slight nod of her head, assuring him it's okay. So:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Michael are walking through the seemingly empty main hall of the church. Looking for anyone who may be hanging out, ducking in and around. They spot a COUPLE, making out in one of the pews. The man is shirtless, the woman in her bra. Caught, they let out an embarrassed CHUCKLE. With offense, but also humor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a house of God, no less? C'mon, get up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple sheepishly exits the room, pulling on their clothes. As they do, they pass: Bobby, Burt, and Joseph coming up the stairs. Joseph pulls up the rear, standing behind his father. Bobby sees Jack and Michael, now seate several rows back. BEAT, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Bobby. Nice suit you got on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gladly gives a nod of recognition, sits down in an empty front pew. Burt brushes lint off his son's shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair's long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I like it this way. (no response, so:) That why you got me up here?    [To] tell me my hair's too long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph speaks up, diverting Bobby's attention:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, I asked Pop to bring you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsamatter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph eyes his father with trepidation, then begins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I'm gonna be heading up a new narcotics team, starting this week. A Russian unit, outta PSA 2 in Brighton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lights a cigarette) That's a good hook for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they need me over there. There's only eleven guys in the whole department that even know the language right now, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks behind him. He's SURROUNDED. Interrogation- style, his brother at the fore, Bobby nonetheless remains calm, almost cheery. To Jack, in the back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm old-fashioned. I listen first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, we need you to do us a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A favor? Oh, he needs a favor! (to Burt, needling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut me off financially, and now you need the favor? `S interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUDGE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack steps forward, a PHOTO in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking at this guy Vadim Nezhinski.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puts the PHOTO in front of Bobby. MUG SHOT of an acne- scarred, dark-eyed man we've seen before: VADIM NEZHINSKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Served time in the Soviet Union for black market activity, come over around 1979.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `S good lookin' boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not amused, they withdraw the photo from in front of Bobb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dealing H, cocaine, angel dust... Operates out of that club you manage. The El Caribe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's sense of humor disappears now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know nothing about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we know that. We checked up and down the rest of management, too--his uncle, the owner--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man?! What, you been watching us?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody come up clean. It's just Nezhinski we're lookin' at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to Burt) What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to track how he's bringin' in the product and...we were just hopin' you'd keep your eyes and ears open a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding me? Inform for you?!? That's what you wanted me here for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we would never ask you to do that. Just observe, that's all. It's a closed community and you're our only way in right now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, find another way. I got a lot invested in that club and I can't let it get fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's gonna get fucked up, Bobby. All it takes is one thing, you know that! One guy to flip, we crack the whole thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Solo pipes up from the back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, it's important. These ain't dumb guys we're talking about. We don't stop `em up front, coupla years from now, it'll be chaos out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd be wishing the Italians'd come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is still focused on his brother, then to his father

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You] Fuckin' broadsided me... Everything's about the goddamned job with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt remains stoic. (Though silent so far, he should be a HUGE presence in the scene--others look to him for reaction, approval, etc.) Joseph sharpens:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whole city's falling apart, Bobby-- don't you got any sense of responsibility at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... Get off your fuckin' high horse and bust somebody else's balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally, to Joseph) All right, go downstairs. Lemme talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt gestures to Mike and Jack, and they exit. Joe doesn' respond at first. Then, begrudgingly, to Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be careful out there next coupla weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'S that supposed to mean?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph lingers, leaves. Father and son. ALONE. Then, staring straight ahead as he takes a drag of his cigarett

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You got me up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you wouldn't help us. I told your brother, I said, `no point even bringing him down here.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Then now you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby starts to leave.   Burt grabs his arm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second--lemme ask you a question. That girl of yours downstairs--she Puerto Rican?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I like the dark meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hooking you up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lets out a chuckle) Why, you want some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, keep laughing--your mother, rest in peace, I think she was too easy on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go, Pop. I'll see you `round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby turns his back on Burt, getting up to walk downstairs. Burt remains emotional, reaching out to his son when Bobby is not looking, lowering it to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is off now. Bobby comes down, Burt follows. Joseph is getting something whispered in his ear by anoth cop. A squat man with a bad toupee starts to speak: NYPD Deputy Commissioner SPIRO GIAVANNIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone?   Everyone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario is leaning up against a post, drinking, watching the party. She stares down a GUY who OGLES HER LASCIVIOUSLY. With a sense of humor, she winks at him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take a picture, it'll last longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby approaches Rosario, grabs her hand:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's get outta here, [we'll] go party with Jumbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tugs her away.   She stops him.   With assurance:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could stay if you want, baby. They don't like me, I don't care-- you're better than them anyway--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waves her off) We're goin'. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurriedly puts down her drink. Joe stands near Spiro, but his attention is on his brother:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Deputy Commissioner Spiro GIAVANNIS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE.    Bobby, Rosario move to the exit.   SIMULTANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we look around in these troubled times, and in moments like this we need leaders, men and women who can bring order back to our great communities. We're here this holiday season to give thanks for one of these men, our Russian brother, Joseph Grusinsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHEERS.   Joseph smiles, waves.   Filled with hubris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Joseph, many of us've known your father, Deputy Chief Burt Grusinsky, for many years, and I know he wants to say a little something. Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE for Burt, who waves, steps up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. You know, I used to tell my kids, "work first, play later," and my son Joseph really took it to heart. He's been a real fighter over the years... He overcome his mother's passing, and the dyslexia--eventually wound up graduating John Jay as salutatorian and distinguished himself many times. (turns to Joseph) Anyway, you've shown yourself to be very brave and selfless, and I'm just, I'm very proud here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG APPLAUSE as JOSEPH STEPS FORWARD. BOBBY AND ROSARIO squeeze through the crowd, to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you everybody for coming-- happy Thanksgiving. Before I say anything else... We got some bad news this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of our Irish brothers was killed in the line of duty last night--detective Edward Conlon was gunned down serving a warrant on Northern Boulevard. The clock's about to strike ten, so I thought we might give a moment of silence to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY STOPS. Instinctively, he turns back to the room, motions to Rosario to stop. Out of respect. She does. Then: the CHURCH BELL rings. TEN TIMES. Silence. The BELL GONGS. The CAMERA DOLLIES PAST: JOSEPH and his family, and JACK, and MICHAEL, then past ROSARIO, and BUR and BOBBY. The bell stops. The SEA of BLUE, the POLICE, genuflect. Our characters do not. Instead, BOBBY STARES at JOSEPH AND BURT across the crowded room. They return the glare, and Bobby exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera TILTS UP to an apartment window.   We CUT INSI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC UP: PRINCE'S "HOUSEQUAKE." Hot girls and flashy- looking guys. The men are drinking. The women make themselves up en masse in front of a large mirror over th sofa. A couple KISSES in the corner. Everyone's getting ready for a night of revelry on the town. They are SINGING, having a GREAT TIME. The decor is late `70's, though not exaggeratedly so. DRUGS are EVERYWHERE. We

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN around the ROOM: a set of weights on the carpeted floor, with clothes scattered everywhere; on the wall, a Jets football schedule, a Led Zeppelin poster. Bobby is PRIMPING in the mirror. Rosario stands on Bobby's king bed, DANCING SENSUALLY to the music in a state of partial undress. She MOVES with great FREEDOM, puffing on a JOINT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be like Madonna. You think I'm like Madonna...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sees Rosario in the reflection; his face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're both Leos, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just like her, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby opens his top drawer to get a watch. REVEALS THOUSANDS OF DOLLARS in CASH, hidden underneath a fake drawer bottom. Traces his fingers across the money with private pride, then puts on the watch. Rosario bounces down on the bed. Reaching under the bed sneakily, she pulls out a small box. She hides it. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to my mother yesterday. She said she'd be okay by herself, so I could move in if I want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without self-pity) Your family ain't gonna be too happy, though. I saw how they looked at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right--they don't like nobody outside their own little world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...you know, cops're fucked up. In my neighborhood, if they ain't taking money, they're beating on you for no reason...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother and my father ain't like that. It's just--the whole thing ain't for me, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby approaches her.       Takes a puff of HER JOINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how gorgeous you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby pushes her down on the bed. Starts kissing her on the neck, lips, then breasts. Caressing her hips, he lean back and looks at her, observing the brightness and kindness of her face. Her eyes--mild, calm, and truthful- and her smile carry him into a wave of tenderness. He moves in to kiss her again, and under his breath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAIT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out a little JEWELRY BOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens it.   A CHAIN.   A SIMPLE GOLD CHAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it's beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes it out, puts it around his neck. She has a HUGE SMILE, EAR TO EAR. He looks at her, moved. A FLOOD OF EMOTION. Sotto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you're so good to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you... And someday we're gonna get a big house together, in New Jersey, with a lotta kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you behave yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gently spreads her legs, starts to rub the inside o her thighs. Then moves to her breast. Kisses her with love. Rosario clutches him, secure. The DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mussed Bobby ENTERS from the bedroom, passing the party Bobby opens the FRONT DOOR: Louis, Hazel. Thrilled, he waves them in. When the rest of the room sees Louis, THEY SCREAM "JUMBO!" He holds his arms aloft, as if greeting a adoring crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh--[The] party's really gonna get started now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--let's all play Spin my Pickle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As EVERYONE GUFFAWS, Freddie the bouncer yells out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Falsetti!    You get what we wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed I did, my friend! (quieter, to Bobby) See, I woulda been here sooner, `cept I hadda go across town, lose all the cops--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There weren't no cops following us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth! You wouldn't recognize `em--they were, they were all undercover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby laughs happily, knowing this is bullshit. Hazel shakes her head, joins the gals. Louis starts emptying hi pockets. Out comes a pharmacy. DRUGS SPILL all over a formica endtable. Louder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I got a little of what everybody asked for here. I got uppers, downers, hash, mescaline, some blow-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any Spanish Fly in there for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you need that, not me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby laughs again, PINGS Louis on the ear. Lou grabs his head, but ignores the needling. Louis looks up, observes Bobby's clothes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's with the suit anyway? You look like a monkey in the circus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm goin' up to see Buzhayev tonight. I think he's gonna ask me to buy into the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, you know what you should do, you should turn it into a fag joint and then maybe they'll let ya in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you a fuckin' faggot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby starts to punch Louis in the arm, playfully but har Rosario enters the room, singing along with the song that playing (YAZ'S "SITUATION"). She moves to Bobby's side, mock punches Louis' stomach too. To the gang, with CHEER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody, I gotta be at El Caribe in an hour, so get ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE, except for the CLICKING of GUN MECHANISMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The troops gird for battle, checking their weapons. JOSEP is here, as are Jack and Michael and a whole gang of cops Bustling by a set of lockers. Very businesslike. Joseph cleans his piece. Michael leans over to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spot's got one main entrance, two rear fire exits. All of `em'll be covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I just wanna make sure we take it easy in there. We don't want no panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if your brother's inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his day off. He ain't gonna be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph clicks his weapon into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he is?    We still go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph is deeply troubled by the prospect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mob scene.    Bobby and Rosario and Louis and the gang en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gleefully shakes hands upon entering, then splits from the group. Rosario joins several girls as they fix themselves up in front of large lobby mirrors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening the door is Kalina, who embraces him.   In Russia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby! Our daughter and her husband Eli come by for dinner. You want something, some tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no, I'm all right... Hi everybody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grown woman, Marat's daughter MASHA, waves while siftin through a stack of FURS on the sofa. One of her young children, a daughter, holds her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat sits at the head of a table with lots of FOOD (including a HUGE SMOKED FISH) on it. He waves Bobby over ebullient. ELI MIRICHENKO, Masha's husband, is seated here, too--trying to talk to his young toddler SON. Bobby sits down, next to Marat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's really rockin' tonight. Line's halfway `round the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toddler runs to Bobby. Bobby lifts the youngster onto his knee; as he bounces the child on his knee, he turns back to Marat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat nods, waves to Kalina for drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, maybe we open another spot next year. Across from Brighton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'S a good move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need someone in charge here full- time, then. And we think you do a great job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that. You know, I been thinking `bout it--I'd like to become a partner here too--buy in with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I got a lot of ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already! He's got so many ideas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just think we could do more. Maybe expand into Sheepshead Bay. I know a good spot--we add a restaurant there, get the spill- over. Like what your brother did, in Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat nods, considering this. Reaches to the FISH. He takes the EYE out of the fish and starts to suck on it. Daughter Masha stands behind her seated husband, holding and bouncing her little girl. ELI antes up, to Marat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gonna take a lot of money, Papa. Your fur business can support that right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat waves him off.    Turns back to Bobby, re Eli:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son-in-law, he worries people take advantage of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can understand that. But I got money to invest--we could make it something real special over there. Do what I did downstairs--you know, bring in name DJs on different nights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat grins from ear to ear.   Excitedly, he nods.   Then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Together we do it. You come to our Thanksgiving again, on Thursday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.   I'll come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good--we talk more, at the dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two hug. Bobby is being shown out by Kalina, and is about to depart when Buzhayev calls to his wife in Russia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him, for tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for her purse.   But Bobby refuses graciously waving it off as he exits:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah nah, no thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE NEON SUN is lowered from the top of the theater. Sitting on it, singing: `80's POP STAR TAYLOR DANE. The CROWD GOES NUTS. As this happens: BOBBY ENTERS, sits down at a table against the back wall. Louis is next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother! How'd it go? (Bobby smiles, winks) Ho, well! I'm guessing it went pretty good then!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen--I get this done, I want you to be a host. In one of our spots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my specialty. I'm whaddaya call, a people person!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just make sure you get your old co-workers from the Health Department to give us a pass on the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no problem--half of `em got rats as pets anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Rosario?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a word, Louis motions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a large CORNER TABLE: VADIM NEZHINSKI, seated in the center. Surrounded by two YOUNG GIRLS and Slavic-featured men and dark-skinned Latinos. A LATINO MAN and one of Vadim's guys, a YOUNG DARK-SKINNED WHITE MAN, converse at the table. After a beat, the two men MOVE TO THE COAT CHECK AREA. CASH stacked on the edge of the table. ROSARIO appears, coming through the crowd. She goes to Nezhinski's table, counts out MONEY for him. Nezhinski appears affectionate with her, sticks some of the BILLS i her hands. Bobby turns away from Vadim's sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit... [She's] With that fuckin' animal again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a player, Bob. You know how it goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him... I'll tell you, [when] this is my place, we'll kick his fuckin' ass right outta here--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob! You gotta watch your mouth! I mean, he don't scare me, but uh, but trust me, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, I'm serious! (moves closer) Last year, one of his guys was gonna flip? Jesus Christ, what I saw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA MOVES INTO A CLOSE-UP on LOUIS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the men's room in the club. Louis is in the stall, his pants pulled down. He HEARS: Nezhinski's voice and a muffled struggle. Louis immediately pulls his feet up, squatting on the toilet seat. Looks into the crack in the stall door. We STILL HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nezhinski dragged him into the toilet. They stood him up against the wall and held him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE exactly this. Nezhinski faces the MAN. Two associates of Nezhinski's hold him back, covering his mou with silver electrical tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fuckin' pulled down his pants, and I swear to God, Nezhinski just cut it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nezhinski's associates pull down his pants, and Louis see the man's bare ass. The man is panicking, muffled cries for help penetrating even the flashback. Nezhinski pulls out his switchblade, holds it up to his face, then LOWERS IT. A GLINT of REFLECTION on the KNIFE. HORRIBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worst thing I ever seen in my life, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, cops found his head in the middle of Brighton Avenue the next day--fuckin' dick was in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure it wasn't your dick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure it wasn't your mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby laughs heartily. Just then, Vadim sees him. Pavel HOLDS UP HIS DRINK in acknowledgement and WAVES HIM OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby walks   to the table. There's a lot of food around Vadim--he's   eating off six different plates. Bobby is really only   focused on Rosario. When Rosario sees him (she'd been   counting bills) she brightens, virtually getting out   of her seat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, honey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--c'mon, join us! I wanna talk to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AD-LIB GREETINGS. Bobby sits between Rosario and Nezhinski. Rosario kisses him, grabs onto his arm; Vadim puts his arm around Bobby's shoulder. Turns to his people

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the fuckin' guy right here. Practically owns the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUMBLED AGREEMENT. The men surrounding Vadim are "yes" men, and they seem to take their cue from him. To Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything all right with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; then, coolly:) Things're goin' good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's real good... `Cause you gotta be happy, you know? All my guys, I tell `em, the mind and the body, they're connected. That's how you stay sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This's "Kid Quick" you're talking to, dude. Best fuckin' middleweight in the Ukraine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks at Vadim's ample waistline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He don't look like a middleweight no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone LAUGHS, Vadim most of all. He KISSES Bobby on th head. Bobby looks at Rosario as Vadim continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Bobby, my uncle upstairs, he, he likes you a lot. Practically thinks you're one of his kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your uncle's a great man. Smart man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Smart smart stupid. Got his head buried in books all day, `stead of the real world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AD-LIB amusement from the "yes" men.   Vadim moves closer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen uh, I come to you, I tell you I got some friends bringin' a load in here, maybe something big-- I'm just talking now--they bring it in, how do you feel about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your uncle loses his license, he ain't gonna be too happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, upstairs don't gotta know everything, am I right? Place gets packed every night, everybody wins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby does not respond, instead nodding to some patrons w shout out hellos. Vadim shakes Bobby's shoulder with affection. Intimate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you should think about comin' in with us. You're popular-- you could help us...expand a little. A lotta money in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I'll think about that. Rosario--I wanna talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.   We'll talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby takes Rosario by the arm away from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bobby moves with Rosario to the bar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It go good upstairs, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta stop dealing. You hear what I'm telling you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These words hit Rosario, and we SEE that she's troubled b her own behavior because she stares at her shoes, momentarily speechless. He grabs her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear what I said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard. But I need the money right now, Bobby. And I'm not gonna rely on you for EVERYTHING--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby purses his lips, frustrated.     Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold off then, for a little while. Okay? I got my reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momentarily confused, she mutters a "'kay," then kisses him. Bobby moves the hair from Rosario's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY'S ABOUT TO RESPOND IN KIND WHEN...       All of a S BOOM! PANIC. SCREAMING. LIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORS at the club's entrance have burst open. LOUD, like a gunshot. COPS enter. Plainclothes and uniformed both. JOSEPH comes in, holds up his badge, which hangs around his neck. WITH COMMAND:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody! Get your hands on your head and don't fuckin' move! (to a woman) Turn off that music. Right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR UNIFORMED COPS BOLT straight to    the COAT CHECK AR ALL KINDS OF DRUGS and WEAPONS start    falling to the FL The patrons are desperate to get rid    of any incriminat evidence, and BOTH MEN AND WOMEN RUN    TO THE BATHROOMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several patrons start DUMPING NARCOTICS INTO THE TOILET BOWLS when MANY COPS ENTER and, with ferocity, hit them with batons to corral them. The TOILETS are backing up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some girls rush in, others are already inside. Two PRETTY YOUNG WOMEN are in the corner, FREEBASING, when COPS BURS IN. One of the Pretty Girls, out of surprise, starts to shake the small pipe flame to extinguish it. The opposite occurs, and the flame IGNITES THE ETHER. THE TWO GIRLS BURST INTO FLAMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Get the extinguishers-- call paramedics!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops pin EVERYONE up against the wall or on the groun EVERYONE IS LINED UP, SEARCHED. I.D.s are checked. Bobby turns to Rosario:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme your shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troubled, she nonetheless puts a handful of pills in his palm. Bobby quickly SWALLOWS them. A UNIFORMED COP approaches Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I saw that! Get your hands on your fuckin' head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is brutally shoved to the floor and searched; Rosar is tossed aside. The Uniformed Cop, to someone else:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessie!   This one just ingested!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All patrons in the club, with rare exception, get forcibl lined up, HANDS CLASPED on the backs of their heads. PARAMEDICS SPEED to the LADIES' ROOM. JESSIE THE COP take out a ketchup squeeze bottle--except it's black--and forcibly fills Bobby's mouth with charcoal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arright, open up--a little charcoal, to absorb the toxin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bobby gags, JOSEPH walks through the club with confidence. The place, though absolutely packed, is uncharacteristically SILENT. He turns to UNIFORMED COP #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give everybody a toss. G.Q.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets Mike's attention. Joseph signals something to him, he nods, moves to the back. Joseph walks over to LOUIS, pokes his gut:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much pizza, right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several COPS laugh. Then: Joseph SEES Bobby, and vice versa. CLOSE SHOT on JOSEPH. He sobers, his brashness muted. Joe walks toward Vadim and his party. Vadim has his face to the wall. Joseph kicks his legs further apart (Joseph takes his frustration about his brother out on Vadim.) In Russian, SUBTITLED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around...    Turn around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim turns around. Joseph starts to search him. a WAD OF MONEY from Vadim's pocket:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to double your money? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim doesn't answer. Joseph takes out a HUGE SWISS ARMY KNIFE he's got on his keychain. He cuts the wad in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   It's doubled now, how's that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Jack search the other members of Vadim's part They rip out pockets. Michael points to a WOMAN'S FUR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got anything in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions for the MINK. She hands it over.       HE PATS DOWN CAREFULLY. NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Uniformed Cop puts handcuffs on Bobby and others. Rosario watches, upset but powerless. Louis is down, next to Bobby. Unwittingly referring to Bobby's brother:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, that cop's crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Fat Albert! Shut your fuckin' mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL OFFICERS charge through now, PULLING THE LATINO M AND THE YOUNG DARK-SKINNED WHITE MAN (in cuffs) from behi the coat check. Bobby is pulled up, on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph interrogating Vadim.   As he looks through I.D.:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a cross AND a Jewish star on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cross is for good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the star for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one's for God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, MICHAEL SOLO interjects.   In Joseph's ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coupla dimes on `em--cocaine, a little PCP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph nods, acknowledging this news.    He EYES Vadim, t turns to the TWO MEN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go. You. And you-- (to the Young Man) You're under arrest, possession and sale of narcotics--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael reads two other men, one of whom is a TALL MAN fr near the table (a lookout, perhaps), their Miranda rights in a totally perfunctory manner. Almost mumbles them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARAMEDICS exit the WOMEN'S ROOM.   Girls are on STRETCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARAT BUZHAYEV enters the main room of the club. He is ESCORTED by TWO UNIFORMED OFFICERS, who are very obviousl NOT ARRESTING HIM. They are asking him questions and writing down his comments. He TURNS TO SEE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUMILIATED BOBBY, who eyes him back. Bobby is then quickly ushered out along with tens of others. Marat watches, as does Rosario. Louis and Rosario are left behind, not having been arrested. Neither has VADIM. Joseph moves close to Vadim. With arrogant brio, re: the Dark-Skinned White Man, in Russian, subtitled:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boy's gonna turn. And then we'll come back for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOSEPH EYES VADIM, virtually mocking him. VADIM EYES JOE BACK with SILENT RAGE on his face. Then the cops push THE YOUNG DARK-SKINNED MAN out, and as they do, he turns back to Vadim. The Young Man is TERRIFIED. Bobby, too, is hauled out like a common criminal. Cuffed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station: 1980's-era, very unlike ones seen on T.V. Th walls are tan brick, peppered with fallout shelter signs. Archaic, Robert Moses era-like. Lit entirely by large fluorescents overhead, noticeably free of those desks and typewriters that are familiar to us from other cop movies A big sign above a bulletin board reads, "WE OWN THE NIGHT." Bobby is led in by a PORTLY COP. A madhouse. There is BLOOD all over the floor, forming a LAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, what the hell's goin' on in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Dark-Skinned Man is right outside the cell, his body in spasm, covered with blood coursing from his neck. Cops huddle around him as he kicks and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russian guy fuckin' slashed himself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After seeing this, Bobby is shoved in his cell, his nose still leaking the charcoal, blood all over his shoes. After a beat, he lies down on the cot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby exits, walks toward the nearby SUBWAY STATION.   SP BURT, who's waiting for him. Bobby ignores him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going? I was the one who got you outta there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot.    I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a real big shot, aren't you! You see what happened in there last night? Hey--I'm talking to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt grabs his son's arm.      Moves closer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you and your girlfriend're only getting off `cause of your brother. Up to me, you'd sit in there another couple days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks around. Nobody's listening. He opens up. With quiet but real fury, and total sarcasm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll go thank him too then. He comes in, raids the fuckin' place--now I gotta go beg `em not to fire me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire you?! From what? Probably the best thing that ever happened to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Pop.    Fuck the both of you's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Burt SLAPS his SON on the side of the head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't EVER speak to me like that again. You hear me? I'll rap you right in the mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckin' touch me!? You gonna fuckin' touch me?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby COCKS HIS FIST. BUT BURT IS READY. A STANDOFF. Then Bobby decides against it, bolts. On BURT as we GO TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY ENTERS. Packed with people. A family get-together for Thanksgiving. Children abound, a PARTY atmosphere. BOBBY is in the FOYER, holding a cake he's brought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several FURS laid out on a felt-covered bench. Into the LIVING ROOM, he sees Masha and ELI seated on the couch, holding the hand of their son, who is dressed in a stripe suit. Upon seeing Bobby, ELI NODS TO HIM and Masha enters the foyer, greeting Bobby with a kiss on both cheeks and taking the wrapped present from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters. Sitting at the large table is MARAT, playin with one of his grandchildren. Bobby knocks on the doorframe to announce his entrance. When Buzhayev spots him, the child hides behind Marat's leg. Marat lets out a laugh at this; to the child:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no--it's okay. Say hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy waves perfunctorily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now--we go this week to the field, okay? To ride the horses? Go to Mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat addresses the boy clutching his leg (AD-LIB a Russi "go"), kisses him, and the child runs off. Bobby steps closer to Marat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Buzhayev... I'm real sorry about what happened the other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [If] I was working, maybe I would've been able to do something, but... Anyway, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat darkens considerably. More interior tone, almost as much for himself as for Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't always control everyone in your family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My nephew, he don't come back to the club anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat brings his hand to his head, looks pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind my saying, I think that's probably the right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things get back to normal, I'm hoping we could get started on what we talked about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) We need time for the bad publicity to go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Buzhayev, my getting arrested ain't gonna be a problem. I don't got a record--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With great effort, Marat stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   I don't worry about any of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arm around Bobby's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to teach chemistry before I come over here, and now I have the fur store, and this. One thing I learned here, you can always start over. So don't worry--someday, we do it. Okay? Someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...   All right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food is ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat looks at Bobby with great sympathy as they walk toward the LIVING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take some time off, everything will be fixed in a little bit. Then you come back. I pay you for the time. Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby mutters a "THANK YOU." Buzhayev touches his cheek. Marat then turns back into THE DINING ROOM, spreading his arms affectionately and wide, yelling "OHHH" to the children as they cheer. ANGLE ON BOBBY as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present: Joseph, Michael, Jack. Joe's seated at the head of a long table, which is covered with coffee, deli sandwich remnants, and police reports, etc. They are working; we greet them in media res.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stabbed himself, he was a bundle guy. Mighta known how they're movin' it. See, that's the key--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL OF A SUDDEN, IN COMES BOBBY.   Intense beat.    Final

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We waited `til it was your day off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to go--I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.   Bobby takes a step toward him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to hit that spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nezhinski was seen there, Bobby! What am I supposed to do--announce it in advance, compromise the whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had plans down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I tried. What do you want from me, anyway? You know, you're standing there feeling sorry for yourself, but you wouldn't be in this shit if you didn't fuck around in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got real balls saying that to me. I made something for myself, and you come in and fuck it up? Just `cause I'm not trying to be like you? And Pop--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, you're the one acting like you're above it all all the time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' around with your little Puerto Rican all day--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you call her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me. Have some fucking class for once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby takes another confrontational step forward.       R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You piece of shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) [You] go around like you're a big shot... You're a joke! Grow up already! Fuckin' loser...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby LUNGES forward, grabbing his brother. Joseph leaps up out of the chair. A FIGHT. Awkward punches are thrown. Messy. Jack and Mike leap in, trying to pull the two apart, hollering "BREAK IT UP" AD-LIBS. The two are split up, panting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come at me like that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come around me no more--I don't wanna have to look at your fuckin' face ever again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine with me, you motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby exits, slamming the door.    ANGLE ON JOSEPH, distressed. Silence, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Joe--forgive me, but uh, your brother... Ever since your mother got sick--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, don't get involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll pick this up tomorrow. I'm gonna go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is quieted as Joseph packs his briefcase...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph drives up to the house, a working-class part of Queens. He parks the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph looks at his knuckles. They are bruised and bleeding. Emotional about the fight, he looks toward his lit house, then opens the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph drops his keys as he exits. Reaching down for them on the asphalt, he HEARS a SOUND and LOOKS up and to his left. A MAN WITH A HOOD OVER HIS HEAD. Looks almost like an old-time Klansman, with two holes cut into the hood fo his eyes. He's pointing a GUN RIGHT AT JOSEPH. Joseph's eyes pop, and he lets out a quick gasp--but he has no rea time to react. The man pulls the trigger. A THUNDERCLAP slaps the silence in the neighborhood:   TH GUN HAS FIRED. A FLASH OF LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MIST OF BLOOD plumes around Joseph's head. The bullet hits Joseph in the face, through the CHEEK. HE snaps back spasmodically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN AUTOMOBILE, a MONTE CARLO, pulls up to the scene of th crime. Another HOODED MAN in the back seat throws what looks like a MOLOTOV COCKTAIL into Joseph's CAR. The AUTO starts to BURN. Joseph lies on the sidewalk, bullet in th head, his blood everywhere. He seems pretty dead to us. The Monte Carlo SPEEDS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shooter slumps into his seat, ducking out of sight of the street. He pulls the hood off, over his head. It is VADIM NEZHINSKI. In Russian:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us onto the expressway... Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph, on the ground. The car burns in relative silence. Dogs barking in the neighborhood. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PAL gym, filled with off-duty cops boxing, jumping rope. BURT hits a large bag that swings from the ceiling. He is dressed in sweatpants and a V-neck undershirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he hammers away, he is involved in some CHEERFUL BANTE with fellow cops:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta keep your hands up! Keep your hands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he SEES, in a LARGE MIRROR: TWO UNIFORMED COPS and t POLICE CHAPLAIN EDWIN O'CONNOR, standing near the doorway He stops his exercise. They approach him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long beat, Burt's expression changes, and he sens something bad. A long look at the men. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which kid is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops turn to each other. Burt tries to prep himself, but it's impossible; we SEE the cracks in his sangfroid:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Joseph. He's at St. John's Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It don't look good right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt does his best to stay stoic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to contact your other son--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Go on, I'll be right out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesitantly, they leave. He crouches near his gymbag. Closes his eyes. The color drains from his face. Then, seeing other cops eyeing him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you lookin' at?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got nothing to do with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL OF A SUDDEN, as if he's been SHOT, he COLLAPSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief!   Chief, you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMOKE AND DRINK everywhere. MADONNA'S "DRESS YOU UP" play in the background. CROWDED. Bobby, Rosario, and Louis are at the center of a poker game. Lou sits next to Bobby, partnering with him in the game and whispering into his e from time to time. Rosario sits next to Bobby and watches the game intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poker pot seems exceptionally large. A STOCKY LATINO MAN is the main one competing with Bobby. Bobby's a mess, maybe worse than we've yet seen him. But he is HAPPILY DRUNK, his eyes BLOODSHOT. He and Louis look at their cards. Rosario turns, looks at Bobby for a BEAT. She sees a small bruise he's got on his forehead, kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, you got a little bruise here--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts rubbing her between the legs, under the table. She kisses his bruise again. Louis pokes her. Smiling and pointing to his crotch:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a bruise too, you know--right here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario lets out a loud laugh.   Louis whispers pearls of wisdom to Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Bob, I think we fold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fold, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby ignores him.   Instead, aloud, to the Latino man:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see you and bump you two C's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered too loud) We will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby turns to him, winks. The PHONE IS RINGING. A LOT. ROSARIO gets up, walks over to the phone near the sofa an picks up with a soft "hello". Meanwhile, Bobby puts a whole lot of cash in the middle. The Latino Man looks at him like he's crazy. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby takes a SHOT OF LIQUOR.    Turns over his cards. has a pair of QUEENS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siegfried and Roy, baby! Two fucking queens!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of tens. Bobby stands, CLAPS ONCE.       Lou, thri jumps up and HUGS Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobkes, I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario has a slightly serious look on her face as she calls out to Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--it's for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head as if to say, "I don't know." Slightl peeved that he needs to attend to the call, he leaves the table. As he does so, Louis, to some girl, proudly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was the one told him to keep goin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Louis grabs the pot for himself as Bobby picks up th phone, several feet away from the ruckus. He covers his free ear with his hand to hear better:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, it's Michael Solo--I got some bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's been shot. He's at St. John's--they're workin' on him now. I just thought you should know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, of course, is stunned. The poker table in the background is a riot, a contrast to the sober message Bobby's getting. He turns his back to the crowd; sotto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is--is he gonna be all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, your father's coming--I gotta go. But he's at St. John's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANG UP. Bobby waits a beat, frozen, then does the same. Rosario knows something is wrong, approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother was shot...they're operating on him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario sees how remote he is, what a blow it is.     She pulls him to her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta go see him--be there for him and your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby eyes her, walks to the table.      A CLOSE SHOT on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game's over, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you shuttin' it down?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.    I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobkes--?   What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, man!    We're in deep here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby grabs his coat. Rosario responds in kind, moves to Bobby. He spins to her. In hushed tones:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna come too. For you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--it's gonna be a fuckin' scene. I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby moves to Louis:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis, lock up and take her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused, he nods) Sure, Bob. Everything cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurt, Rosario spins around and enters Bobby's room, closi the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no--I just remembered I gotta do something, that's all--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pats Louis' arm as if to reassure him. Then the Latino Ma tries to grab some of the pot. OTHER PLAYERS REVOLT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--HEY!     What the fuck?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGHT BREAKS OUT. Louis moves over to the WOMEN, holdin them back (odd--they weren't going anywhere to begin with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, TAKE IT EASY! Calm down and everything'll be, uh, non compos mentis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSHING, SHOVING. PUNCHING. Bobby exits his place, leaving behind Rosario and Louis and chaos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby walks briskly to the entrance. MEDIA are all around but they aren't paying attention to him. They are elsewhere, with members of the police, each other, etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters. The room is jammed with officers and friends, including many faces from the opening party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the cops don't seem to recognize Bobby at all. the NEWS MEDIA are outside, banned from the hospital's interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURT emerges from the hallway. He sees Bobby, at first comforted by the sight of his son. But quickly he darkens and starts to walk right past him. Sotto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt keeps walking.    Bobby follows:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop, he all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby touches his father's arm, and Burt spins around:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? You stayed out of it--you got what you wanted. Why don't you go somewhere and pick a fight--you're good at that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is speechless for a moment. Burt pulls his arm away and walks on. A MUSTACHIOED COP approaches Burt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, the union sent a shrink over for you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I don't want that crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENTER: someone we recognize as the MAYOR storms in with h ENTOURAGE. The COMMISSIONER (WILLIAM RUDDY--we'll see him later) and Deputy Commissioner Spiro Giavannis are with h too. They approach Burt. Bobby moves aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, your honor. Commissioner. Thank you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Grusinsky, an attack on an officer is an attack on society. Whoever did this, in a clean neighborhood like that--they gotta be hunted down like animals.
