dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get `em, your honor. I'm gonna come back in and run it myself--we'll get `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile: MICHAEL takes Bobby's arm, walks him into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room with payphones. There's a window through which we can SEE the WAITING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shot went in his cheek and come out through the jaw. It missed his brain, thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT on BOBBY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was real lucky--considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) I need to see him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby starts to exit.   Michael stops him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--that ain't a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably should've told you not to come down here--there're a lotta things going on right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys blaming me for this? Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I ain't judging you--I called you `cause I thought you had a right to know. But we're gonna be going hard after Nezhinski--and maybe some other people you're close to. Like that girl you know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit--she's clean.      You fuckin' keep away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby realizes that NO ONE WANTS HIM HERE. He looks through the glass to SEE Burt, still speaking to the Mayo Bobby storms out of the room to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns toward Intensive Care. SEES a CROWD DOWN THE HALL. Two GUARDS block the doors to the ward. Determined, Bobby decides to walk over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Nobody's allowed in except immediate family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got some I.D.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby hurriedly takes out his wallet. As he does, we HEAR a SOFT CHIME. A WOMAN'S VOICE SOUNDS on the P.A.:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. As a friendly reminder, visiting hours will be over in five minutes. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says here your name is "Green."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look--I'm his brother, you fuckin' hard-on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stares at the men for a beat, then makes his move. Charges past the Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards stop him, and a messy struggle ensues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of a sudden, Joseph's wife SANDRA emerges from the ward. She looks devastated. The struggle stops. All fall silent, out of respect. Bobby steps back. Sandra turns to look at Bobby. To the Guards:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby walks toward the entrance.   Stops.    Sandra seems read his mind, speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alone. Your father just left for the precinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby nods subtly, mouths a "THANK YOU." The Guards step aside. He walks to the doors. Pauses. ENTERS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph's bed is in the back of the large space. His face is blocked by hospital curtains. Bobby steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, he walks to his brother's bed. He peels away the CURTAIN. Looks at JOSEPH'S FACE. Joseph's visage is completely RAVAGED on the left side, covered with bandage that are soaked with blood. A TERRIBLE IMAGE. The emotion surges within him; he's HEARTBROKEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a surprisingly painful moment. We can TELL he didn' expect this level of destruction. His mouth drops open slightly. Joseph's eyes open just a bit but don't look at Bobby. Bobby slowly lifts his fingers, touches Joe's arm gently. His fingers move down to his brother's hand. Joseph is unresponsive but conscious. All of a sudden:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph's hand closes around Bobby's fingers. The connection is huge. Bobby's eyes well up, and he rubs them, almost ashamed of the emotion. It is a shocking OUTPOURING of FEELING from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over haltingly, kisses his brother's forehead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm sorry--I.C.U. visiting hours are over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits a beat. The Nurse gently pulls his shoulder. He backs away, his eyes reddened. The camera MOVES INTO a CLOSE SHOT on BOBBY as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud, active hallway of a housing project. Graffiti on the walls, trash on the floor, but FULL OF LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby emerges from the elevator, emotionally distraught. He SEES, in one far corner of the hall, two young Latino teens smoking CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to one of the apartment doors, KNOCKS.    Opening door is a LATE MIDDLE-AGED LATINO WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her, is ROSARIO. (The woman who answers the door i clearly Rosario's mother.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario's mother discreetly backs away from the door. He and Rosario stare at each other for a moment. Bobby grope for words. His emotions bubble up inside of him; then, barely audible, his voice cracking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Feels like it was my fault...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sinks down, holding her tight, his head at her stomach She gently strokes his hair, kissing the top of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head to reassure him, whispering "no...no...". In this moment, he needs her. In this moment, he is like a twelve year-old boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across from the El Caribe. It's like a scene out of Balm in Gilead here--raucous clubgoers are eating burgers and drinking coffee after their nights on the town. Bobby and Rosario and Louis sit at one of the tables. Bobby kisses Rosario on her forehead as she reaches into her purse. Sh looks through a small ziplock bag with a vial of cocaine. Louis, meanwhile, is unaware of Bobby's state of mind, an is busy putting on a show--as usual:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you run off to, like a Jew? You got outta there, it became like a real zoo. The spics-- (looks to Rosario) `Scuse me--the P.R.s, they're goin' nuts for the money--picka picka picka picka--and the girls, they're screamin', and I'm keepin' everybody in line. I'm fuckin' bustin' heads, like Bruce Lee--I'm fuckin' bustin' heads--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and starts kicking and chopping in the air in the clumsiest manner possible. Accidentally kicks the waitress, who's bringing the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, `scuse me, sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby picks up the check, hands Louis some cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hercules, do me a favor--before you kill a waitress, go pay the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arright. But I'll tell you Bobkes, nobody else could ever do for you what I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis smiles, walks off.    Scoops up the tip from a near table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell Louis nothing about what happened. Far as he knows, my family moved away, [a] long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't ever gonna say nothing! I just thought...maybe he could cheer you up a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby kisses her atop her head. JUST THEN: VADIM AND HIS GANG enter the establishment. They create a ruckus. Spotting Bobby and Rosario, Vadim ambles toward them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look who's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Vadim... (as Vadim approaches) We were just gettin' something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; to Bobby:) You make it through that bust okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gives a simple nod as well. Inside, Bobby is extremely uneasy, though outwardly he is quietly confiden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have nothing on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without making eye contact, Bobby shrugs; then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your uncle's got some problems now, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does what he gotta do, I do what I gotta do. He don't own me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rosario) Baby--why don't you go keep Jumbo company, make sure he leaves a tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Kay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario leaves the table.    Two GIRLS walk by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Bobby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby nods to them.    Vadim watches them walk away.   Th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know-- (moves closer;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still got my shit coming in. Some of us think you could help get it out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little dangerous right now, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a lot of muscle behind us. Lotta muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brazenness of the comment shocks Bobby. He looks up, begins to focus. Incredulous. Softly, as the camera ZOOMS INTO a CLOSE ANGLE on BOBBY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muscle--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop got hit today. They ain't never gonna sit still for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another member of the gang speaks up: Pavel:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police are a fuckin' joke, dude-- the Mickey Mouse ain't gonna do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pavel LAUGHS, and Bobby looks at him with real resentment Vadim pushes Pavel aside, motions for him to sit down elsewhere. Vadim pulls up a chair. Sits down. Intimate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, those cops--they, they ain't no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim turns over his hand.   A SPIDER WEB TATTOO graces t palm of his right hand:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see this? I got this on the inside, at Tchita. You earn these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't worry--we'll get `em all. Cut off the head, the body'll fall, right? You keep on doin' it `til they get the message. (even quieter) We got all their names. On a list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim leans back in his chair. Bobby's eyes widen. Vadim makes a "POP" sound. Bobby tries to hide his shock. Vadim grabs Bobby's arm, squeezes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just think about it. You change your mind, you call Pavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; then) I'll see you around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the men move to another table. Bobby looks at Rosario and Louis, who're standing by the register. They turn bac to Bobby and SMILE, totally unaware of the conversation that's just taken place. CLOSE SHOT ON BOBBY as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a huge municipal structure.   Bobby bolts inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is hopping, with police everywhere. Almost like a fraternity house. BOBBY CHARGES IN, looks around. Pushes his way through the crowd toward the main desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERGEANT PROVENZANO, forties, rings a SILVER BELL, which engraved with the words, "Homicide Bell." The room quiets down. Provenzano holds up his hands. Grinning:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody! Our little "A" House got another coupla stiffs today, so it's time for another poem! (catcalls; reads from a pad) "The people of Brooklyn have been volleyed and thundered; at last the number slaughtered has reached one hundred!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE. Provenzano bows.        BOBBY shoves his way th the crowd. Urgently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to find Deputy Chief Grusinsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, he's on the second floor, I think. In the muster room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks down the hall.       He SEES his father, talk a CROWD of UNIFORMED COPS.       Burt sees him, keeps tal Bobby touches his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop, I gotta talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important--I got information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby pulls his father aside, looks around to be sure the two of them are out of earshot of others. Forcefully:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is surprised.       His attention sharpens:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt realizes the severity.       Then we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, you gotta be kidding me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large room, lit by fluorescents. Mostly empty of furniture in the center, with vending machines against th wall and a sole IBM PC in a corner. A huge GUN RACK is on the wall, conspicuous, a hint perhaps of the violence to come. It is Bobby and Burt, Jack and Michael. Bobby's been telling his story. He and Burt are seated--Jack look out the small window in the door, then turns the LOCK for privacy; and a nervous Michael is pacing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nezhinski got a hit list? On us?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks at his father, then nods.      Mouths an almo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael purses his lips, then spins around to Burt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go bust `em, Burt--right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON BURT.    He betrays no hint of concern:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They'll be back on the street in a day. We gotta try and catch `em with their hands full--find out where they got the real weight. Then we can move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could take us forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. It's our only play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncustomarily, Jack speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we go hit `em all. Wipe `em out, suicide-by-cop--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talkin' about?! C'mon, don't be a first-class schmuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we don't got the time to infiltrate `em--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt lets his temper flare; briefly, we SEE a more mature version of Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we make the time! (to Mike, Bobby) Look, I want you all to understand something--we don't ever play in the dirt here, okay? Not ever, no matter what!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You piss in your pants, you only stay warm for so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about callin' in the Feds? They got a lot more juice than we DO--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunch of college boys from Kansas. We protect our own here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sees an opening:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop, Nezhinski's been talkin' about a shipment he's got comin'. Maybe that's how you get to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you know about that, Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somewhat sheepish) They been wanting me to buy in for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael turns to the others.    Brightening:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe that's it, then. If we can get him-- (re: Bobby) To set something up, maybe one of our uncles could move in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Bobby; with some ridicule) It'd have to be him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, set something up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd go set up a buy with `em, just like they've been asking you to. We follow you to the spot, bust `em a week later. That way, your name's clean, nobody knows you're involved--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too dangerous for him! We don't know how solid his cover is out there! (to Bobby) That girlfriend of yours, she knows about you, right? So can we just get back to the discussion please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   Bobby is dead serious:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could trust her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm glad. But it's not happening. So forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...but you could get killed--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me, just worry about yourself, arright? Anything happens with your brother I'll call you. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   Bobby is still there, fixated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Bobby exits.   We GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters his room, which is dark. Rosario is here, asleep. Her back to Bobby. Upon hearing him enter, she turns and looks at him (and US) in SLOW MOTION...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sits on the edge of the bed, touches her back. She senses something wrong and speaks, voice ravaged by sleep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said on the television your brother was doing better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and my mother, we said a prayer for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something seems to dawn on Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother's real important to you, ain't she. You'd do anything for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Bobby, who appears deep in thought:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thinking about your brother? About your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was nothing you could do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby leans over, kisses her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lies down next to her, still fully clothed.    Stares at the ceiling. She whispers to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby? It's all gonna work out... You'll see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Jack and Michael. Burt is talking to the others in front of the hospital, but we are in WIDE SHOT, and we can't HEAR them. Burt shakes their hands, then walks inside. Mike and Jack walk in the opposite direction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY stands inside an abandoned parking kiosk. (He's bee watching from afar.) Jack and Mike approach their parked car. He tries to obscure himself partially inside the kiosk. They see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been up to see my brother...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Your father's still with him- -we were just gonna go back to the PSA. Try and figure out a tac plan on Nezhinski.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...How's that been goin'...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't got much yet, but we'll do our best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby hesitates, then reveals himself completely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I... I been thinking...if you could keep it confidential...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd make the connection for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'MON--BOBBY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They trust me--we could go in large, use my money for the buy, they won't suspect anything--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too dangerous--you heard your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He don't gotta know anything about it. Does he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything went wrong, he'd never forgive us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just--I realized... (strains to utter) ....my father dies `cause of all this, I couldn't live my life knowing I coulda done something. (looks at both men) I know the same is true for you.   I know it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So please--can we do this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Michael turn to each other.    Then: ANGLE ON BOBBY PRELAP a PHONE RINGING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small office equipped with telephones, headsets, and fo out chairs. Lockers line the walls. Bobby's on the phone, waiting for someone to answer. REVEAL: Jack and Michael a here too, with HEADPHONES ON, LISTENING IN. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  It's Bobby Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I decided--I wanna buy in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much we talkin' `bout here, dude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks to the cops.    They start mouthing something but he ignores them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty k, to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Jack's hairs stand on end upon hearing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, [the] man's gonna be good with that. How `bout tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arright. We'll meet at El Caribe, `round midnight? (with a sly laugh) That way, you could dance a little, say hi to your girlfriend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most expensive phone call I ever made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get it back for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack reaches into a nearby LOCKER for something, then approaches Bobby and hands him a small BLACK BEEPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen: from now on, you'll get all your information through this, at an undisclosed location. Your contact with us is over after you leave here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby takes the BEEPER.     Michael touches his shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be smart about things. Okay? You get burnt and we gotta put you in protection, it's still better than winding up dead. An informant dies, they talk about you for a day. A week later, ain't no one remembers your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moral of the story is, don't die. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON BOBBY as he sobers.   Nods.   Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to promise me something, though. You won't investigate my girlfriend--she's, she don't know any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't be a target. Just make sure she don't open her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael grabs Bobby's shoulder, a gesture of affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know we known you your whole life, kid? Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters the bedroom. Presses his answering machine button, and a message begins to play. It is Rosario.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Bobby. It's me. Just wanted to see how you were doing--I guess you're at the hospital now... I hope your family's doing good... Okay, I love you... Jumbo says hello too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As her voice plays on the machine: he moves to the dresse where he opens the top drawer. INSIDE: THOUSANDS OF DOLLARS--his SAVINGS. He begins to take the money out of the drawer and count it when: we HEAR a SOFT BUZZ. He quickly looks over, CHECKS THE BEEPER. He stares at the paged number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN #1 stands by a bench, almost floating in the fog. H is stocky, dressed in a down vest. Bobby enters the frame trepidatious; he and the man eye each other for a moment, then Bobby holds out the beeper. The man takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN #1 takes out A KEL DEVICE LISTENING UNIT and its accessories. Among them, a CIGARETTE LIGHTER. He UNSCREWS THE LIGHTER. Complex electronic innards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wire's in here--we're gonna follow the signal. Find the stash house and make the deal, you leave the rest to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna leave me all alone out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs; then) I ain't gonna lie to you.   There's always a risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man #1 hands Bobby the LIGHTER.    He FIRES it.    It wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your cover's blown, call for help-- don't try and be a hero. Just get outta the way--place could turn into a butcher shop. Talk about pussy--that'll be our signal to come in early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come up with that one all by yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores the joke) Just do the deal and get out. Bear in mind, your life is in that lighter. Anything goes wrong, the department'll get word to your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man unceremoniously turns to leave.     Then, suddenl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And oh--G.Q. told me to tell you-- your brother's coming along real good. They reset his jaw and sometimes he's awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby acknowledges that with a single nod of his head. Th man departs. Bobby grasps the lighter tight, looks at the man as he virtually disappears back into the fog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is an older Catholic church, a beautiful interior. A line of young Latino women hold candles, singing as they walk toward the altars. A HEALING MASS. Rosario is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lights a candle at the altar, then walking back to th pew, she SEES BOBBY and approaches. Bobby looks around, seeming harried and paranoid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--what're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks at her, his eyes filled with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I--I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming home in a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't respond at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He appears almost in tears...    Finally, sotto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I--I'm gonna inform. For the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna help `em set up Nezhinski.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario is shocked.     Almost inaudible:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she steps back, he moves forward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to do it, Rosario. These motherfuckers--they were gonna come after my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario tries to recover.    Can barely speak.     Sotto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Nezhinski finds out, he'd kill YOU--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't ever gonna find out.    He ain't ever gonna know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if something goes wrong? What's gonna happen to you?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I'd, I'd probably have to go into protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario breaks down, tears flowing.    Her hand to her mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's never gonna happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you not even talk to me about it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby spins around to see if anyone's listening.      He her into a dark corner of the church:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario, listen--I had to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby pulls her to him, holds her tight.    In her ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to do it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario is emotional.    Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's gonna be all right... Don't worry, it'll be all right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still fervid, she is silent.     CLUB MUSIC up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters the place, determined. He has A BAG tucked under his arm. Many CLUBGOERS say hearty HELLOS to him. People are dancing, having a glorious time. LOUIS IS HERE THRILLED to see Bobby. He HUGS him, effusive, heartfelt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobkes! My brother! I been calling you all week! Where you been?!? We missed you!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Sorry, buddy--I got some legal shit to deal with, from the raid... But I ain't forgot about you--I'll be back soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, without you around I hadda lower myself here by hangin' out with Freddie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gently pats his old friend's shoulder.       Interr this, Freddie steps in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, hey! Mr. Buzhayev'd love to see you, I'm sure--want me to tell him you're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay--I'll talk to him later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He then walks by the COAT CHECK. He and ROSARIO see each other. He turns, SEES Pavel, in back. Pavel waves to Bobby, and Bobby starts walking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby approaches a table, reserved for Pavel and the rest of the gang. Bobby joins them, with his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Vadim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he don't come in here no more--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got fifty grand in here. And it don't move `less I deal with the man himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So [if] you're interested, I wanna see your stash, right now. No bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pavel thinks a moment, eyes his cohorts.       Back to Bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be on the boardwalk in a hour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby turns to leave.    Pavel calls after him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And dude--this don't shake out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pavel quickly draws his hand across his Adam's apple. Bobby exits, passing by ROSARIO as he does. She gives him a fearful look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The famous Brighton Beach boardwalk. Bobby stands in the cold, waiting, holding his bag of money. Alone. Takes out the LIGHTER, the LISTENING DEVICE. He fires it--it works. Looks at his watch. In rummaging through his pockets for smoke, he finds a little slip of paper with a phone numbe on it. He APPROACHES a nearby PHONE BOOTH. Bobby holds the paper in his hand, dials the number. A voice answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOSEPH on the phone, in bed.      Nearby, Sandra is foldi blanket around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby SEES Pavel's CAR DRIVE UP.      Bobby hangs up the Takes a deep breath. We HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude!    Hey, dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby approaches the car. Pavel is in the back seat, calling to him with the window open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby approaches the automobile. Pavel is in the back seat, calling to him with the window open. Another American sedan behind them. Bobby enters Pavel's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby takes the front passenger seat.      Pavel is behin Someone we DON'T KNOW is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is somewhat edgy, with Pavel behind him. The car pulls away from the curb. Then: Pavel throws a small towe over Bobby's head. POINTS A REVOLVER AT BOBBY'S TEMPLE. Bobby is startled by the action, blinded. Trying to stay calm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your hands out, where I could see `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your fuckin' mouth and do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby obliges. The driver, looking anxiously in his rear view mirror, makes a SHARP LEFT, and the car VEERS. Pavel then PATS BOBBY DOWN, searching for a wire, anything incriminating. To the driver:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn at the light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAR makes A SHARP LEFT.      In Russian, subtitled:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go left.    Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Livery Car makes another brutal SHARP LEFT, tires screeching just slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pavel again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.   No one's on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera MOVES INTO a SHOT OF THE HOODED BOBBY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Livery Car pulls up to the curb. We are on: a strange residential street with tenements and graffiti everywhere Dark, deserted. Many silhouetted figures stand in doorway up and down the block. They are all armed, with shotguns and machine guns slung over their shoulders. A GARBAGE CA IS ON FIRE a few yards away. The men get out of the car. They pull Bobby out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk up the stairs, PULLING Bobby up over the steps. He stumbles. They pick him up, lead him to a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone pulls the hood off him. Bobby looks around. The room is ABSOLUTELY BARE. The driver puts Bobby's bag of money down on the floor. A TEENAGED BOY wearing a SURGICA MASK comes and puts one on Bobby's face as well. Bobby surveys the place. Where the hell is he? With that mask on his face, we HEAR his BREATHING, loud and present, through the sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be night or day, we wouldn't know. The windows are blocked with duct tape to obscure all light. There is VISQUINE hanging from seemingly everywhere. Parts of room are cordoned off with the material. SILHOUETTED FIGURES ROAM through the space like apparitions. A SLAVIC-LOOKING MAN takes Bobby's bag of money, leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands Pavel, masked as well, armed now with a Kalashniko rifle. Without a word, he motions with a move of his head to Bobby. "FOLLOW ME," he seems to be saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters the room, right behind Pavel. He SEES: a dresser with a clock on it and a small mirror. Tables set up in the middle of the room with brown jars on them. There is a television on in the corner, a Russian ethnic musical program silently unfolding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are other people in the room: a BROWN-HAIRED MAN; a two dark-haired SLAVIC-LOOKING WOMEN. It's an assembly line for the preparation of narcotics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SLAVIC MAN takes out the STACKS OF BILLS. Starts counting them methodically. Pavel motions to the Brown- Haired Man, puts up two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cue, the Brown-Haired Man rubs his hands together, the takes two large JARS from his desk. Beneath the desk, Bobby spots what looks like an ENORMOUS NUMBER of package of NARCOTICS, stacked against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is clearly THEIR STASH HOUSE. The Brown-Haired Man pours powdery contents from a jar out onto his desk blotter. He sits down, takes off his jacket, REVEALING: TATTOOS, UP AND DOWN BOTH OF HIS ARMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The designs combine several images--skulls, snakes, and t SPIDER WEB element that marked Vadim's own tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a RUSTY LETTER OPENER--it had been sitting atop the desk--and pierces a GREEN PACKAGE. White powder seeps from the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby watches from behind the mask as the man pushes and pulls what looks like pure cocaine in powder form. He use two PLAYING CARDS to move the drug. Bobby eyes that RUSTY LETTER OPENER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brown-Haired Man dips a measuring spoon in another powder to add to the mix. He is cutting the drug. He continues to manipulate the substance, and his hands move with a kind of grace that one expects from a seasoned che on a cooking show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT on some lines of COCAINE. Pavel takes a toot. He OFFERS it to Bobby as a taste. Bobby accepts. He pulls down his mask momentarily, RUBBING a RATHER LARGE QUANTIT OF THE DRUG ON HIS GUMS, HIS LIP. We HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needed to come here tonight...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks over to see: EMERGING FROM THE BLACK, FROM DO A DARKENED HALLWAY: VADIM NEZHINSKI. Everyone is wearing surgical mask--except, of course, for him. Bobby eyes him with eyes that seem to become more BLOODSHOT by the secon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, ain't Pavel good enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all the money I got.    And I ain't gonna leave it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slavic Youth finishes counting Bobby's cash:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all there.     Fifty grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim points to the MONEY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From my savings. From El Caribe and Rasputin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; then:) That buys you three keys in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the crack on the street, it's worth two hundred k. Maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim walks over to a stack of green packages:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the shit I get here is at least eighty-six percent pure. And we got a lot more comin' in--a LOT more. In a way nobody could ever trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim steps away from the narcotics and towards Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole city'll be sucking our glass soon--you'll see. We push the Guineas out, the Domos'll work for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim looks at that money again, takes a step forward. Bobby's forehead has beads of sweat. Vadim walks up close Looks Bobby in the eye for a BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're breathing heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took a little taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim puts his hand on Bobby's chest, checking his heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I seen fighters--they breathe like that, means they get nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby shakes his head. He is wired, out of it, but he pulls himself together. His jaw clenches. With fire, an edge of defiance:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna search me again, you go `head. I just wanna make this deal and go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim violently pulls out Bobby's pockets. Out falls: a WALLET, SOME CHANGE, KEYS, A CIGARETTE LIGHTER, MATCHES. He sifts through the items, lighting the lighter. It fires. Bobby gets slightly edgy. Notices that the others congregate around the objects from his pocket--all except for Pavel, who holds an AK-47 trained on Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby inches ever closer to the rusted LETTER OPENER that the Brown-Haired Man had used to open a package of cocain Vadim puts down the lighter. And it occurs to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got both matches and a lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby realizes instantly that Vadim is right. Bobby shrugs, feigning innocence. He braces himself and decides to give the signal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get pussy from this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you say...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks around.   There's NO CAVALRY TO THE RESCUE. tries again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [When] this deal goes down, I'm, I'm gonna get a lotta pussy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still NOTHING. PAVEL'S attention turns to VADIM.   He mov toward NEZHINSKI, who:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starts FRANTICALLY POUNDING THE LIGHTER against the DESK. Trying break it open. Bobby scans the joint... The MEN are trained on that lighter, and this is his chance. He slips the LETTER OPENER into his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SEEMS LIKE WE CAN LITERALLY HEAR THE BLOOD RUSHING THROUG
dialogues.text: BOBBY'S HEAD NOW. Setting himself, Bobby looks around the room--where's that backup???--and: the camera SPEEDS PAST Pavel's and Vadim's faces, to the other side of the room. It MOVES toward the WINDOW:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VADIM HITS THE LIGHTER AGAIN. This time, it BREAKS OPEN. REVEALING A BEVY OF WIRES. It is CLEARLY NOT JUST A LIGHTER. The camera TILTS UP. VADIM IS ENRAGED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got a wire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill this motherfucker, right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT LOOKS LIKE HE'S A GONER. PAVEL RAISES HIS GUN and CHARGES TOWARD BOBBY--ABOUT TO FIRE, when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR BURSTS OPEN. COPS EVERYWHERE. Mike and Jack lead the way, but there are what seems like tens of EMERGENCY SERVICES UNIT OFFICERS with them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands on your heads! On the floor!

dialogues.speaker: NO ONE FREEZES. CHAOS. GUNFIRE. PAVEL SWINGS BACK TO
dialogues.text: BOBBY, a TERRIFYING LOOK ON HIS FACE. But Bobby is ready, and SHOVES THE LETTER OPENER INTO PAVEL'S NECK. BLOOD CASCADES DOWN THE MAN'S CHEST. Pavel collapses on Bobby, still very much alive. His eyes are popping, and he throw his hands around Bobby's THROAT. VADIM CHARGES INTO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he pulls up a SECTION OF LINOLEUM, REVEALING a TRAP DOOR that leads down to the apartment BELOW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HORRIFYINGLY--DRUG PEDDLERS, ARMED with all kinds of GUNS POUR OUT from rooms everywhere--on the FIRST LEVEL of the building as well as the THIRD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL PUSHERS ARE HIT. THE POLICE have their gear and are reasonably protected, though TWO OF THEM ARE WOUNDED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets SPLINTER the floor beneath their feet and the wal right above their heads. They have their backs to the wal as their only cover... PERCUSSION GRENADES THUNDER throug the STRUCTURE...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY IS CAUGHT IN THE MIDDLE. STILL STRUGGLING WITH
dialogues.text: PAVEL, this has become the madness of war. Pavel bleeds profusely all over Bobby's chest, and this is a fight to the death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby wrenches the LETTER OPENER out of Pavel's collarbon and desperately--and repeatedly--stabs Pavel in the base the neck. Pavel's screams mix with gunfire to make a hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THAT MOMENT: A SHOTGUN BLAST blows the top of Pavel's head clean off, spattering Bobby's face with brain particulate. Bobby is forced to get out from under... We

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VADIM slides down to the BACK ROOM in the APARTMENT BELOW Panicked, he cocks his gun, searches for an escape route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gets up, into a crouch, amidst the gunfire.    Dodg the bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ESU Police Officer does not recognize Bobby as an ally and he trains his assault rifle on Bobby. Bobby screams, his hands raised:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you!     I'm with YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is INAUDIBLE, with all the ammo being dispensed, and Bobby knows it; so he dodges the Officer; the Officer begins to unload his weapon, getting CLOSER to BOBBY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AND CLOSER.     Bobby is about to be killed when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby FALLS roughly twenty feet through the air. His body tumbles upside-down, toward a wrought-iron FENCE that surrounds the base of the apartment building's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby HITS the FENCE. His LEG GETS CAUGHT on one of the small spikes. He SCREAMS as we GO BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop cars pull up by the dozen, from EVERYWHERE. Out of on comes BURT GRUSINSKY, carrying a shotgun. He charges righ into the structure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nezhinski opens the window, about to go out onto the fire escape. A WARRANT UNIT OFFICER is below. Looks up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt!   Police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it right there! Hands on your head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VADIM SPINS AROUND.   FREEZES.   His hands are in the air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officers pour in, among them BURT. Cops forcefully push Vadim to the ground. Start to cuff him. Burt pulls Jack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my goddamned kid?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is speechless--he doesn't know. (We SEE that Burt's question--revealing Bobby's identity--REGISTERS on VADIM' FACE.) Vadim mutters, aloud but sotto, in Russian:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is a dead man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not comprehending) Shut up! Get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt frantically PUSHES THROUGH THE CROWD OF COPS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is upside-down, hanging from the fence, but he is alert. Two members of the EMERGENCY SERVICES UNIT approac him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On sheer instinct alone, he starts to PULL his LEG off th small SPIKE, his teeth clenched. An ARMY of ESU TROOPS an PARAMEDICS come to BOBBY'S AID...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY is being lowered from the fence. An AMBULANCE ZOOMS UP the STREET, to the alley. Burt rushes to his son. Jack and Mike come right behind him. Bobby looks at his father, his face nicked by many small cuts from the glass Sheepish, he cannot say a word and averts his father's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna be okay, Chief. (to others) Clear out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt eases when he hears this. They move Bobby toward the ambulance. Burt turns to Michael. Sotto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys go on a bust like this and you don't tell me about it? You think I'm born yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a real comedian! He's gonna need to be in protection now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sits up on the stretcher as a MEDIC treats his leg. Burt approaches, watches for a moment. The Medic leaves the post for a moment, and the two are ALONE. Burt stares at his son, who finally speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right, Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head; then:) Well, I guess I don't have a say in anything anymore. Anyway... You did it. You did it and it took real balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now you're burnt--and we gotta get you someplace safe, keep you under wraps for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to get my girlfriend, Pop. I need her to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is getting emotional, aware of how close his son cam to death. Trying not to show it--and failing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get them to take care of that. Just go get yourself fixed up-- that's the most important thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, the Medic returns, and with a heavy heart, Bur closes the ambulance door. Bobby is alone with the Medic for a moment in the back of the vehicle; he watches throu the window as his father walks to his car. Bobby sinks to the cot, lies down. AS VADIM NEZHINSKI is LED AWAY in HANDCUFFS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOCAL NEWS CHANNEL: the STORY is about the BUST: MAJOR NARCOTICS SEIZURE, 40 KILOS OF COCAINE. An OFFICER is KILLED; Two PERPETRATORS (among them: PAVEL and the SLAVI MAN) KILLED. Four others wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE THAN A DOZEN ARRESTS. We SEE the PERPS, lined up against the walls. VADIM NEZHINSKI'S MUG SHOT. We're told he's AWAITING TRIAL. In a RELATED STORY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A news report on Joseph Grusinsky's release from the hospital. He is a hero, she says, and she tells us it's been five months since his shooting. He is GOING HOME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several POLICE CARS line the block. There are ARMED OFFICERS perched on rooftops. As PROTECTION. Many of the houses have "WELCOME HOME" banners hanging from them. The media are here. NEIGHBORS are on their porches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed with people and playing CHILDREN. Lively. Food everywhere. TWO ARMED GUARDS stand against the wall. A CROWD surrounds someone. Then, as the CAMERA DOLLIES CLOSER, people move away to reveal: BOBBY, seated in a chair against the wall. His leg is bandaged. AD-LIB friendly HELLOS from partygoers, who surround him and tre him respectfully. PAN OVER TO REVEAL: ROSARIO, seated nex to him. She sits quietly; his arm is around her shoulder. People are STARING AT HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPIRO GIAVANNIS (we saw him at our film's beginning--he's the Deputy Commissioner and he's in uniform) shakes Bobby hand enthusiastically. He uses his hands to cup Bobby's:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, hi! Spiro Giavannis, Deputy Commissioner. Glad to see you made it out here today!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They let me come--long as I brought these guys with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby points to the ARMED GUARDS next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the leg treating you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... It's rehabbing good, for only nine weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't matter, I wasn't no Fred Astaire before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUGHTER from others.    Bobby's expression changes, sobe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, it ain't nothing compared to my brother, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AD-LIBBED AGREEMENT from others.    A FAT LADY peeks her in, calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody, they'll be here any minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RUSH toward the door.    Rosario leans in to Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, I'm gonna go outside for a minute, have a smoke--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on, `til he gets here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any idea what you're gonna be doing after the trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure yet... We been thinking about moving down to Miami. Guy I used to work for, his brother's got a place down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, that's great. Well listen, you need any help, you give us a call. `Cause we can be part of your family too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives Bobby his BUSINESS CARD. Bobby takes it, mutters a "thank you." Spiro pats him on the shoulder, leaves. Bobby turns to Rosario, knowing she's somewhat out of pla here. Children run by, having fun. Bobby eyes them, then he leans closer. Sotto, tender:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lotta kids here, lotta family... It's nice, ain't it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.    Whispered:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how happy I am you're with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over, kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RANDOM WOMAN, who'd been looking out the window, turns back toward the house. With a huge smile on her face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby brightens, begins to stand with only a little difficulty as he anticipates Joseph's entrance. As this happens, Rosario slips out from under his grasp:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Be right back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she walks off.    Bobby watches as she enters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario closes the door on Bobby, turns on the running water. Then begins to rummage through her purse. Finds a small vial of cocaine inside. Takes it out, opens it, but DROPS IT IN THE SINK. The drug spills into the water, washing it down the drain. Frantically, she tries to finger whatever residue is left on the porcelain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENTERING THE HOUSE: JOSEPH and Sandra, his wife. Joe hold two bags--one filled with cards and memorabilia, the othe with clothes. What seems like a ZILLION PEOPLE are here when he walks in. Everyone CHEERS. BURT moves right behind him, all smiles. Joseph is thrilled--but somehow not the same. His face doesn't look bad, but one eye is a different color from the other, and he's had reconstructi surgery on his jaw. There is, of course, a scar, and he's lost a lot of weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, Burt waves everyone closer. Jack and Mike and other faces we can recognize from around the precinct sta back, all smiles. AD-LIB HELLOS. An elderly NEIGHBOR comes forward, giddy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, fella! You look great! (pointing to his own

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your eye--does it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when I look at you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUGHTER. Then Joseph FREEZES. He NOTICES: BOBBY, next to the ARMED MEN who haven't left his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two brothers make eye contact. The crowd quiets a bit Bobby smiles at the sight of his brother. Joseph gets emotional, too:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bobby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a word, Bobby nods, moves to his brother. As Burt looks on, pleased, Bobby takes his hand and grips the bac of Joseph's neck. Joseph pulls his brother to him by his neck. A real embrace. Joseph pats Bobby's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm real glad you're home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two separate, both smiling gently. Breaking the momen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone, let's, let's move inside-- there's plenty to eat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft laughter. Small talk begins. The group dissipates, moves to eat, etc. Burt moves to Joseph:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph--we got some things we need to discuss, when you get the chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could do it now if you want, Pop. In the den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt nods, reluctantly. All our men walk to the den-- except for Bobby, who hears: ROSARIO, down the hall. She approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, I'm gonna go back to the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? They got a lot of food over there--why don't you go eat something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) N--I'm gonna go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Bobby senses she's not completely right. Looks into her eyes, then, more an accusation than a question:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucked up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A muttered "no" from Rosario, hardly a committed denial. Before he can say anything, from the DEN, Burt peeks his head out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--you should hear this too, for the trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt motions for Bobby to enter the den.       Back to Ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta straighten this out later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby then moves to the den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Joseph and Jack and Mike.    Bobby enters the ro As he does, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nezhinski's cache was huge, about 40 keys--yayo, some angel dust too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna try and turn him, get him to tell us how they're bringing it in. But don't worry--we'll make sure he does plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't gonna be reliable, Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby closes the door behind him softly.       Joseph see Bobby, is surprised he's here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you marry an ape, you don't complain about the stench of bananas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's at Rikers. Tucked in, nice and comfy. We're taking him to the A.D.A. next week, for a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna go with you on that. See his fuckin' face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, though--streets're dead. Junkies're waitin' out there for something big, no question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's `cause we got their number one. Dried it up at the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of a sudden, a VOICE from behind:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That don't mean nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns around, slightly surprised Bobby's opened his mouth here:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a whole network full of suppliers. The organization goes deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--you done a lot for us already. You don't gotta get involved in this anymore. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked him to come in, Joe. If he's gonna have to testify, he should know all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This's police business, Pop--you gonna make him an honorary member of the Force now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ugly beat.    Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be outside if you need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby exits, and Burt watches him depart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unaware crowd is having a great time. Children run around the rooms. Bobby SEES GUARD #2, approaches. Burt comes up next to him, takes him into a corner:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was said in there, he--he didn't mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby contemplates this; we SEE that he tacitly accepts h father's words. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why's he goin' back to work so soon, anyway? He ain't ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--it's better this way. I don't want him sitting around with nothing to do, feeling useless--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is about to leave.     Burt stops him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, c'mere. (Bobby returns) A lotta people been talking. About how good you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think maybe...considering the alternatives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...maybe you might wanna think about joining the Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could pull some strings, get you through the academy with an early LEAVE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, come on! I don't want that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I did, I did for you guys, this once. I got my own plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby motions to his bodyguard. Burt senses he's said the wrong thing. Gently tries to stop him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait--Don't go yet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Guard) Take me back to the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Bobby leaves with his bodyguard. Burt stands there for a moment, frustrated. TEDDY, his grandson, runs past him. Naked. Sandra follows the boy. Burt turns to see the naked youngster, then to Sandra:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you put some clothes on him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cheesy hotel on Queens Boulevard. TWO UNMARKED CAR pull up. Armed Guards exit the autos first, casing the area. They're followed by Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby approaches his room. A Guard, we'll call him VITT, is outside the room holding his shotgun. Nods a "hello". Bobby moves past him, opens the door. The ROOM is EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario?    Rosario!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   Then Bobby spins around, furious:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHERE THE FUCK IS SHE?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of PEOPLE are HERE. It's PACKED. We are on the DANCE FLOOR. MUSIC: GRANDMASTER FLASH'S "WHITE LINES". ROSARIO DIAZ is in the center of the crowded floor, danci up a storm. She is having a GREAT TIME, surrounded by man would-be male suitors and Louis. She is laughing and stoned, and her gyrations are wonderfully erotic and free As she moves, she pushes the men away with a smile. All, of course, except for Louis. Louis dances a CAN CAN with two amused girls. Though fat, he's surprisingly graceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL OF A SUDDEN: COMING THROUGH THE CROWD: BOBBY. When Louis sees his friend, he lights up. Bobby's furious inside, but strangely calm outside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobkes!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby GLARES at Rosario. He takes her arm, starts to walk her out. She tries to pull Bobby toward the dancing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, honey--let's dance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops're right outside--let's go. (beat; louder) I said, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't gotta yell at me, Bobby. (starts to move to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...[I] was just trying to have a little fun for once, that's all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou--no more of this for her.   It's too fuckin' dangerous now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Bobkes. I mean, she come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby grabs Rosario by the elbow.     She yanks it away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!   Lemme get my coat at least!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario moves toward the coat check, and Bobby follows. he does, Louis walks with him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Bob, everyone's been askin' `bout you. We was all real surprised to hear about your family- -I mean, your father's like J. Edgar Hoover--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--we'll talk later, buddy--I'll call you. But right now I need to get her outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis nods, understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario leads Bobby back toward the ESCORT CAR.      He l forward, grabs her arm. Sotto but intense:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta put everything in jeopardy? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I was just dancing! I didn't say nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I don't think you realize how serious this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta ride this out, `til this fuckin' thing is over. `Til I can get things back on track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down at the ground, she exhales. Hits the side of a nearby car gently with the palm of her hand, frustrated

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, what do you want from me? I can't go out, I can't do nothing-- it's like I'm in a jail--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But I'm workin' on it, I am. (looks around; then) Soon as the trial's over and I get my money back outta impound-- everything'll get better, you'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets emotional.    Shrugs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just, I feel...I feel like it's just you and all those cops all the time. And they look at me like I'm a piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby tries to comfort her, reaches out to her arm. tears come out of her eyes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario--once this's done, we'll go down to Miami... [It'll] be a new thing for us--a lotta opportunities...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to Mr. Buzhayev about working for his brother down there. We'll get your mother to come too-- I'll even talk to Jumbo about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slight comfort. She nods. Bobby leans over, kisses her. He tenderly puts his hand on her face. She kisses his hand. Their GUARDS are WATCHING. She smiles, and that love returns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... Let's go back--this'll all be over soon. I promise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim Nezhinski is being led, in handcuffs, into an unmarked Chevy. Both JOSEPH and Jack are here. Joseph and Vadim exchange looks as Vadim is placed into the back sea Joe's expression is pure suppressed rage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go in the lead car. You stay with him `til we get to the A.D.A.'s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph gets in his lead car, also an unmarked Chevy.    B vehicles pull away from the curb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE Bobby's ARMED GUARDS waiting on the steps.    TILT TO the closed door. Over this, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard all about you in the news. We were all very sorry about your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Marat Buzhayev, inside the living room.   Bobby sits down, on the couch's armrest; Marat is in an easy chair, his lunch being served on a T.V. tray in front of him by his wife Kalina. The television plays a Russian movie, and Marat seasons his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... You know Mr. Buzhayev, I come to see you today `cause...with everything that's gone on, I don't think it's a good idea for me to stay in New York anymore. I was hoping maybe you could ask your brother if I could work with him, down in Miami. On his restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could talk to him. I think he would like you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat turns to Bobby, puts his hand on his knee. Emotiona

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to be very sad if you're going. Having you here in this house meant a lot to us. You know, my wife and me, we have only daughters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always been very important to me too. (checks his watch) I should probably go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--you'll always be welcome back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is moved.    The two embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is moving. Jack is driving. Another cop is in the front passenger seat. Two other cops straddle Vadim. Silence, then, motioning toward Joseph's car:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did good.    On his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your fuckin' mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Joseph looks back at Vadim's vehicle, behind him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a deal today, maybe my brother don't gotta take the stand... Least that's something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack puts a cigarette in his mouth, turns to the cop next to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that lighter.

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGER'S SEAT FLIES RIGHT THROUGH THE FRONT WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: He's probably killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops see this accident.     The DRIVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the fuckin' car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Joseph PULLS OUT HIS GUN, READYING HIMSELF TO DO BATTL

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CAR PULLS IN BETWEEN THEM. AUTOMATIC WEAPONS FIRE
dialogues.text: immediately pins Joseph and the other two police inside t vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE MEN IN SKI MASKS emerge from the van, automatic WEAPONS IN HAND. JACK PULLS OUT HIS PIECE and immediately begins firing at them, using the wheel and dashboard as cover. He opens his door to slink out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other two officers are immediately riddled with GUNFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of the men PULL VADIM toward them. The third man in a ski mask is hit by Jack's fire, but has just enough adrenaline to get into the SECOND CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt, dressed in his v-neck undershirt, is reaching into jar of B & G pickled tomatoes. The television plays " PEOPLE'S COURT". THE PHONE RINGS; Burt grabs the receiver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?   What's the matter? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   Burt looks disturbed, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! Listen to me--you and Jack get someplace safe. Let ESU take care of it--I'm gonna go get your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt hangs up, grabs his jacket--which had been draped ov the kitchen chair. Burt bolts out of the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Rosario, in media res.     Bobby lights a cigar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, my Aunt's in Miami. We probably could stay with her for a little bit `til we get settled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe. Why don't we give `em all these bags to throw out--it's becoming a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK. BURT BARGES IN. Rosario stands. Other Cops come through the door as well, beginning a move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nezhinski's out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother was taking him to the A.D.A. and they got ambushed. They hit three of our guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...   What about--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's fine. We gotta get you moved--you've been here too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks to Rosario, who's in shock.      Burt looks t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to pack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two start packing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our characters are leaving the hotel, bags and all. The RAIN comes down in SHEETS. They pause under the awning, waiting for the cars to be brought close. Burt stands under the awning, looking out at houses beyond the parkin lot. Rosario is rummaging through her suitcase as Bobby stands nearby. Vitt approaches Burt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, we got three vehicles coming around the corner. Backup's on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt nods, Vitt runs off. The sound of RAIN. Bobby is putting his BULLETPROOF VEST on, SEES Burt STARING OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see something out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt shakes his head, moves to help with the vest:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, we're good. It's just, I just realized--I know this neighborhood. I used to come with my father, to work on the plumbing, for the houses--brought me along to do the talking. He only spoke Russian his whole life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, it's all changed now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD approaches:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more minute, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop?   Joe come close this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I heard he did good, though. You know, with everything that's happened--who knows? Maybe all this'll bring us closer together someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once this is over, you and your brother, you'll talk, you'll work things out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe.   But you know the way he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--your brother, I think he probably feels a little guilty, with everything you did, with you in protection now... But he appreciates what you've done--I know he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario is right behind them, listening. When Burt stares at her, she averts his gaze. Burt changes course:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm just trying to keep us together here, that's all. That's all I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relents a bit; nods) I know, Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt warms slightly, too. A beat, then the CARS PULL UP. Bobby looks at his father with real feeling. Burt eyes him, then touches Bobby's cheek, a truly loving gesture:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) Okay... (to an officer) We'll move `em to Corona. I'll lead the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby takes Rosario's hand as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE CARS: Burt in one, heading the route. Behind him is Bobby and Rosario's car, with guard Vitt behind the wheel and the two of them in the back seat. A third car has TWO OFFICERS in it. That vehicle trails the other two. The CARS DRIVE OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Rosario are in the back seat. She looks through her pocketbook for some gum, he remains focused on the vi through the windshield of his father's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's driver, Vitt, follows Burt down the streets. RAIN is FALLING frighteningly HARD, to the point where the windshield wipers aren't moving fast enough for the water on the windshield. Upsetting. Visibility's terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars swing onto the Kosciusko Bridge loop. The traffi is sparse this early morning. We HEAR the THUMPETY-THUMP of the bridge beams and the windshield wipers.
