And we HEA the steady, haunting HUM of the bridge surface beneath th wheels of the automobiles. Bobby puts his arm around Rosario, in the back seat. Re the rain:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really coming down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--I think I left my watch at the hotel--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby does not answer, instead spots an OLDSMOBILE drivin alongside his vehicle. Seems a bit suspicious, the way it's moving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--Vitt--I think somethin's on our right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! A BULLET punctures the windshield, but we don't HEAR the SHOT. The hole SEEMS TO APPEAR almost out of nowhere. The windshield cracks down the middle... VITT IS HIT in the SHOULDER, and he lets out a piercing cry. Blood hits the seat. Rosario screams. Bobby pushes her head down, into the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAR starts to swerve. Bobby climbs awkwardly over to the front seat. Takes the WHEEL, forcefully pulling Vitt to the side. To Rosario:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario crouches, covers the back of her head with her hands. THE WATER gets pushed away by the speedy wipers

dialogues.speaker: REVEALING
dialogues.text: OTHER, SIDE TO SIDE; THEN, A HUBCAP--we don't know from which car it's been dislodged...

dialogues.speaker: COMES SPINNING AT INCREDIBLE SPEED. AT BOBBY'S WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: Right at BOBBY, RIGHT AT US. WE BLINK. Bobby swerves. THE HUBCAP SKIDS OFF the front windshield. Bobby brushes up against the guardrail. We SEE THAT IT is all that protects him from spinning off into the river, two hundre feet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby darts from lane to lane, and the THIRD POLICE CAR-- behind the Olds--has SLAMMED on its BRAKES to avoid hitti Bobby's car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE OLDS IS RIGHT NEXT TO BURT'S CAR.      BOBBY SEES the barrel of the gun swing to Burt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER BIG PUDDLE--A MUFFLED THUNDERCLAP sound... The water slides away, REVEALING that the back window of Burt car has shattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is startled at this, his mouth momentarily drooping open. He CAN SEE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS FATHER, FIRING his WEAPON out the window at the OLDS. We HEAR BURT through the RADIO, a STATIC-RAVAGED SIGNAL:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got a hit on! Get support, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby pulls up alongside the Olds. Looks inside. He tries to get a good look but cannot. He SEES TWO people in the car, one driving and one doing the shooting--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!   And it punctures a hole in the side of Bobby's re door.   Rosario is JOLTED--screams again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario!   You hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, her face still buried in the vinyl. She's hysterical--but physically unharmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic gets denser now. The WEATHER is terrible, blinding. Rushes of WATER COVER the glass around the car, wrecking visibility. We ARE ON: the B.Q.E., with many trucks, big and small, on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Olds weaves in and out, in front of and behind, many large semis. BOBBY WATCHES AS: Burt's car is right behind the Olds. This is unbelievably dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRUCK starts changing lanes. The Olds scoots past it before it does, but: Burt does not. THE TRUCK CLIPS Burt' car on the driver's side. He sneaks through, recovering and keeping up the pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck starts to skid on the drenched roadway. Then: I JACKNIFES, spinning out. The Police Car behind Bobby's slams into the truck, making a MACABRE CRUNCHING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY'S EYES, as he turns around and witnesses the horrif accident through the RAIN-SOAKED rear window. It is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck CRUSHES the Police car, its carriage flipping over and flattening the vehicle and probably the people inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Olds skids ferociously, pulling off the expressway toward city streets. Burt's car follows. Burt's car and the Olds are neck-and-neck. Bobby pulls up beside Burt. Into the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop, lay back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Burt does not. Burt has a clear shot at the hooded ma in the back seat. HE FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HIT! We can see the BLOOD spatter the perp's automobile The man's head jerks back spasmodically. We HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him!   I got the sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: CLOSER...SILENCE... He sees, through the rain: a LONG SHOTGUN BARREL come out of the window from the rear passenger's seat area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes pop. The OLDS SPEEDS UP.    THE BARREL OF THE SHOTGUN turns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATER covers the windshield, BLINDING the driver (and us) The water slides off the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY WATCHES as BLOOD COVERS BURT'S FACE. He's been HIT. He loses control of the automobile... Bobby freezes, IN DISBELIEF. IN HORROR. HIS FATHER HAS BEEN SHOT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the RAIN, we SEE: a patch of parochial school children, ASIAN CHILDREN, on the streetcorner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's car peels off, away from danger. Burt's car IS HEADED RIGHT FOR THEM. In what seems like his dazed last gasp, he SLAMS on the BRAKES. The car skids out, spins. The motion is DIZZYING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE OLDS is uncontrolled. The vehicle moves through a traffic light, HITTING another car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is one intense image. The car is upside down now. It slides for tens of feet before stopping. Smoldering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain falls, making an oddly serene sound.   We HEAR SIRENS. The Police are approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt's car stops slowly. He gets out of the car, his face a mess. He stumbles for a few feet in the rain. BOBBY'S CAR ARRIVES on the SCENE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURT'S EYES ARE RED, filling with blood. His JAW is open. He gasps for air, a vacant stare on his face. His body spasms. Then he collapses, on his knees. FALLS. FACE DOWN. IN A POOL OF BLOOD. The Police are in the background...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT of the BLOCK as BOBBY MOVES TO HIS FATHER, WHO LYING ON THE STREET. Bobby bends down, turning his father over. His father's blood is all over his hands now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other cops surround them. Bobby looks up at all of them, they at him. Broken, he pushes the others away. As water drips off his face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuckin' look at him! I said don't--back up! Don't look at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby eyes his father, spent, crestfallen--but not histrionic. The CAMERA TILTS DOWN. The BLOOD from BURT'S BODY flows into the street, along the curb,into the gutte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Rosario, outside an office. Armed cops are up and down the hall. We HEAR conversation through the walls Bobby is standing, smoking a cigarette, holding back tear Rosario is seated on a nearby bench--wet, shivering, stunned. Rosario looks to Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby?   Could I call my mother...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speechless, Bobby nods.     Jack emerges from the office, approaches Michael:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I.D. on the guys in the car. Probably illegals. But Mike-- (pulls M. closer) --We had that place locked up tight. How they knew where they were, I go no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Bobby) We gotta get you to a secure location, Bobby--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, emotional and glassy-eyed, interrupts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does my brother know yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; then:) He's taking it very hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had to sedate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These words hit Bobby.     His eyes close, forcing tears his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you gotta take me to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna go see him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael turns to an OFFICER, motions. The officer leaves. The camera DOLLIES INTO a CLOSE SHOT of Bobby and we GO T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting on the couch is Joseph. He is trying to be stoic, but appears wan and tired. Alone. We HEAR the crowd in the house, but they are in the living room. A KNOCK: Bobb enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph eyes him, seems heartened by the sight of his brother. But he is out of it, emotionally bludgeoned:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll catch `em, Bobby. Don't worry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby walks over to Joseph, stands close to him.   Search for words. Before he can speak:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna need us to identify the body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, as emotional as we've yet seen him, Bobby strains t get the sentences out of his mouth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can do that.   I MEAN--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby breaks down. Joseph responds by CLUTCHING him tightly. The brothers rock back and forth gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna stay close to you from now on, Joe... (into J's ear) I wanna stay with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shot is of a small and bare room in a Queens funeral home. In the center is a COFFIN. The camera DOLLIES TOWARD IT. Entering the room is an UNDERTAKER, with Bobby and Joseph right behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know mere words cannot suffice in this time of tragedy. We're so very sorry about your loss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Undertaker unhinges the coffin. Inside is Burt, eyes closed, clothed in a suit. We don't see the body; what we DO see are the reactions of his two sons. Bobby's grief i obvious, but he's already seen him dead. This is new territory for Joseph, who though he does not break down, seems overwhelmed. Both young men nod in acknowledgement, and the Undertaker closes the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm told you're going to be handling the arrangements for tomorrow's service--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you come with me please? (to Bobby) We'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Undertaker leads Joseph away, Bobby enters an:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where waiting are Jack and Michael. Bobby gives a fiery stare to the two cops. He approaches them. Sotto but intense, his teeth clenched in a simmering anger:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna fuckin' catch these guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nod.   Bobby senses uncertainty:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't got nothing, do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks to Jack, who steps forward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All our uncles on the street been hearing about a big deal, goin' down maybe Monday or Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know where yet, but...we got a feeling--[now that] Nezhinski's out, he's gonna be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing emotional) You gotta find that spot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and your brother don't gotta worry about any of that. Just take the time you need--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men all turn around.    Joseph stands there, wounded

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be ready to come back and head it up. I'll be ready and, and we'll get `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph turns and reenters the room with the coffin. Bobby WATCHES him from behind, as his hand runs along the top o the casket. We HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIMOUSINE pulls up against the backdrop of thousands of tombstones. Emerging are Bobby and Joseph. They are both wearing dark sunglasses. Rosario and Sandra and the children get out behind them and are led away by funeral coordinators to another place in the coming processional. In the distance, many many people and a long line of cars move toward the two brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Undertaker walks away briefly, to direct some traffic Bobby slowly puts his arm around Joseph's waist, promptin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby... I'm real glad you're with me now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph grows more emotional, adjusts his sunglasses.    L to Bobby, clears his throat. Sotto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I was...I was jealous of you, [for a] long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is surprised to hear this admission, and is taken aback by the honesty of it--especially in this moment. Joseph grabs his brother's arm, his voice cracking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I always did what Pop wanted. And you were free...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby tears up, his voice breaking too; he shakes his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.... I did it to hurt him...   I disappointed him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interrupting the moment, the Undertaker approaches:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Undertaker guides the two men toward the procession. Just as the drums reach a THUNDEROUS VOLUME, we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of cars files into the cemetery, led by the HEARSE The procession is PHENOMENALLY LONG. The New York skyline is in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNIFORMED POLICE LINE the narrow road. The COFFIN is removed from the HEARSE, put on WHEELS for the move to th gravesite. Bobby, Joseph approach. The DRUMS CONTINUE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People get out of their cars. Many of them we recognize from elsewhere in the film but don't know by name. One of the people to emerge from a Town Car is MARAT BUZHAYEV an his ever-present BABUSHKA WIFE, KALINA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walk begins, with everyone saluting Bobby and Joseph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, the Mayor, the Commissioner, all the rank an file of the Force. The turnout is enormous. Rosario is here too, though several rows back. She is with the women

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby peers at the procession, which is made up of hundre of SALUTING COPS, others. AMONG THEM, we SPOT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, BOBBY SEES his old friend, and the two ma EYE CONTACT. Bobby is greatly moved by his appearance, an nods subtly to Jumbo. Louis salutes gently, a slight and sympathetic smile coming across his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMULTANEOUS: Joseph takes a look at the COFFIN, grows mo distraught. He breaks down. Bobby is there to catch him and does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several WHITE-GLOVED COPS move to help, and then, trying recompose himself, he squeezes his brother's forearm for support. Tries to straighten:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's all right... I'll be all right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is devastated by seeing his brother like this and i momentarily rendered speechless. He tightens his own gras around Joseph, leads him on the walk behind the COFFIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario. Walking. Eyeing the Cops, the Cop Wives. She does not fit in. Cops are staring at her. She SEES COP WIVES looking at her, leaning over to each other and TALKING ABOUT HER. Though she can't hear what they're saying, she is made to feel terribly uneasy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario quickens her pace away from them, and the MARCH MOVES ON...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line of police and relatives now heap dirt onto the coffin, which is in the ground. BOBBY and JOSEPH silently lead the line, shoveling dirt and moving on. Rosario move behind them. Bobby SEES: BEYOND THE CEMETARY GROUNDS: TEENAGERS have climbed the trees. And they're LAUGHING at the spectacle. Michael stands next to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then Bobby speaks in a way that's preoccupied. Almost as if the words are more for himself than for Mike

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't live like this no more, Mike... They destroyed my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a deal going down, I... I wanna help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a civilian, Bobby. Ain't no way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby leans closer, more focused:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, I could join you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael turns to him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Pop tol' me you pull guys outta the Academy, guys with special knowledge, [and] make `em cops? You could do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, come on--you got your own life to live--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I can't do nothing else now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, as Mike ponders.     Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you gotta understand--this ain't something you do just for a vendetta. You gotta go back to the Academy when you're done, you gotta commit yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks at his brother, then back to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a couple days--I'll talk to the P.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby again eyes Joseph, who stands over the grave wiping his eyes with a handkerchief. He WALKS OVER to him, puts his arm around him. Into his ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, I'm gonna join you. I just decided...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph looks at him for a moment, nods subtly.     Then h looks back into the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where I belong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE BACK on Bobby, as he spots ROSARIO, who stares righ back at him. He's GOING TO HAVE TO TELL HER HIS DECISION. A LINE OF POLICEMEN in white gloves begins to FIRE RIFLES into the AIR. FIVE SHOTS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fairly run-down place, on the way to Kennedy Airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is still in his funeral suit, standing near the sof Smoking a cigarette, holding a drink in his hand. An ARME GUARD accompanies Rosario into the hotel room--they've arrived home from the funeral separately. She turns her back to him, puts her handbag down on a dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby eyes the Guard, who promptly leaves the room. places his drink on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna talk to you about something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns.    He starts to take off his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking of...maybe joining the Force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from Rosario yet.     Surprised and not surpr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I help find Nezhinski, we don't gotta live like this the rest of our lives--moving every three fuckin' days...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him for a moment, then stares at the floor. Shakes her head. She gets emotional:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, I don't know if I can be here no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? I just got through telling you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think maybe it's time I leave then--go down to Miami on my own, with my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to stay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you do that. That ain't safe for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that's not true, Bobby. They're not after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second--I know what I'm talking about'd be a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be a big change for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is still shaking her head, still staring at the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gets up, walks over to the desk. Rubs his fingers o its surface, not looking at her but resolutely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we could make a life here. This'd be something we could build on. We could raise a family, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This seems to focus Rosario who stares at him.      He mo closer to her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty soon you'd fit in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I wouldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know what I was--what I was DOING--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll accept you if we're TOGETHER--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She halts him, opens up.     Tearful:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave it all up for you and you changed everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gave it up? Gave up what? (beat; explodes) GAVE UP WHAT, ROSARIO?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What fuckin' life did you have? You're a fuckin' cokehead--look at you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; deeply hurt) And you were clean, Bobby? We were TOGETHER--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I was a piece of shit too! Wasting my goddamned time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is momentarily speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you say that...? We had PLANS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up!   All that was nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Now is nothing! Look at what's happened to your family, Bobby--your father, he's dead--look at your brother! It could all happen to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother's gonna be all right-- and nothing's gonna happen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment, then she turns to walk toward the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--where you goin'--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me!   Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her by the wrists:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TUSSLE. As he tries to restrain her, a torrent of emotion explodes from Rosario:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me--I don't want it! It's not what I want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks free. Panting, tears streaming down her cheeks After a beat, Bobby seeks to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Why don't you just calm down and think about it a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think about it, you'll feel different. You'll understand. And in time, we'll look back on all this and you'll see I was right. Look--I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go get some rest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a word, she turns and walks back into the bedroom Closes the door. Bobby sinks to the couch, picks up his drink. After a beat, we HEAR a:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We appreciate your patience, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he looks into the CAMERA. We can't yet TELL where we are. He continues, backing up from us slowly, leading us somewhere not yet in focus:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commissioner is here now, and he's ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN AROUND to REVEAL: BOBBY GREEN, as he steps forward in FORMAL POLICE UNIFORM. His HAIR is cut, closely-croppe now. He is clean shaven. A REAL PHYSICAL TRANSFORMATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lavish room. Filled with photographs of important peopl shaking hands, receiving awards, etc. COMMISSIONER WILLIA RUDDY, a middle-aged, balding, and yes, ruddy-faced man, here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all very sorry about your father--he was a great man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. I'm gonna try and do my part too, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Raise your right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruddy leads him to the corner of the office. Bobby is guided into position as: the Commissioner picks up a smal leather-bound black book. With one hand, he holds the Bible upon which Bobby places his hand. With the other, h holds a manual, off which he reads an oath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I hereby pledge and declare..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby repeats after him. (This process continues until th entire PLEDGE IS COMPLETED.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I, Robert Green, hereby pledge and DECLARE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of Bobby in the POLICE ARMORY. He is RECEIVING his GUN an his BADGE. Over this, we STILL HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "--that I will support and defend the Constitution, both of the United States government and the State of New York, to the best of my ability..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks down the hall, with his back to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...I will faithfully discharge my duties in the rank of rider in the New York City Police Department. So help me God."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruddy and Giavannis shake Bobby's hand vigorously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT on BOBBY, PAUSING right before he enters the MUSTER ROOM. HE takes a breath and ENTERS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many cops, mug shots and files strewn all over. A discussion, in media res. Many cops approach Bobby, all o whom shake his hand, AD-LIBBING WHISPERED "HEY, BOBBY" an "WELCOME TO THE FORCE." Bobby thanks them, then moves to stand behind his brother. Michael testily grills Jack on the investigative progress:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But we got our guys   out there, working the street all   over? I mean, they coupeing or   they working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's out there, bustin' balls, left and right! What else you want us to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Michael says the following dialog, a UNIFORMED OFFICER comes up to Bobby. Sotto, in his ear, he speaks to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, a Rosario Diaz's been callin' for you. She says she needs to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.   I'll call her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you tell Narcotics Queens we got an A-1 sale hanging over our head and either they help us or we fuckin' take it out on `em later!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Uniformed Officer leaves, and Bobby stays put to hear this exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Nezhinski's uncle? That clubowner--Marat Buzhayev?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean. We tailed him for weeks. Goes out with his grandkids, takes `em horseriding at Floyd Bennett Field... Checks on his fur business from time to time--we even looked at some of the coats and tore `em apart. Turned out to be fake sable, if you could believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's comin' up quick, we don't know anything... We're gonna lose it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe--this is still new territory for all of us. I mean, we hadda use your brother here to get any results to begin with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael points to Bobby, who up until now had been focuse on--and concerned by--his brother's behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. And my family takes the hit--my family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence.    Everyone's pained.   Bobby stiffen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you guys go outside for a minute? I wanna talk to my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael hesitates, then nods. Everyone wheels around and exits the room. Jack follows Mike out the door. Bobby turns to his brother:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to do everything-- it's gonna kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs ruefully) We don't got much time...we lose Nezhinski, we're both dead... [The] streets'll get flooded, the whole City's gonna be on fire--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could handle it. I mean, I come on to help you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't ask you to do that. I don't need your help--I could deal with it on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But you don't gotta do everything yourself. That's what I'm trying to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby eyes Joseph, who looks deeply troubled.   Bobby sit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, what's wrong? Come on, you can tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deal this big, something's gonna come up. You'll see--someone'll fold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph ponders for a beat, then comes out with it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that. It's just... You give up what you wanted to do to be here, Bobby. And part of me feels a little responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, you didn't do nothing. It's meant to be. You can't fuckin' control it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slight laugh) You know, I remember when Pop was mad at you, he always used to say you didn't believe in our family. And Mom, she'd protect you. She'd give you those little caramels... Anyway, I knew he was wrong too, but I didn't say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then: the Uniformed Officer KNOCKS and RE-ENTERS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, Rosario Diaz just called again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I'm on my way back now. (to Joseph) Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all in the past. (kisses him) I'll see you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An UNMARKED CAR with Bobby inside pulls up to the front. GUARD steps forward to greet, protects him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters. There are several guards in the space. Bobby scans the room, and quickly notices EVERYTHING OF ROSARIO'S IS GONE. Bobby wheels around, to a GUARD. INTENSE EXPRESSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened--where'd she go?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She left about an hour ago.   She said to give you this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUARD hands Bobby a NOTE.   BOBBY SEES IT, GRABS IT WITHOUT READING IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go find her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She asked us not to, Bobby. She's-- Bobby--we can't do that legally!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby tries to charge past them. The Guards all restrain him delicately ("C'mon, calm down"), but Bobby is in no mood and instead starts a melee. He is a tour de force of energy, and it takes no less than everyone here to subdue him. The FIGHT is more a WRESTLING MATCH than anything else, and it is messy, tough:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T--FUCKIN'--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's forehead is cut; the struggle is UGLY. The Guards rouse up enough strength to PUSH HIM into the HOTEL ROOM for GOOD. THE DOOR SLAMS. A SILENT BEAT. Bobby paces, in a rage. Then, sarcastic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go `head!   Keep me in here--KEEP ME HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, we don't wanna have to put you in restraints, so just calm down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm the fuck down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stares at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna keep me here? HUH?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in a fury, he takes a lamp and HITS THE DOOR REPEATEDLY. Then he HURLS the lamp toward a mirror on the wall, AND IT SHATTERS... Exhausted, he stops. Moves to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he sits on the edge of the bed, touches his neck. BLOOD on his hand. He STILL GRIPS THE UNREAD NOTE. He throws it to the ground; and then, perhaps motivated by t realization of his situation, a flood of feeling comes ov him. Tears begin to fall down his face, and he succumbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is as though all of the emotions in our story find the outlet here, in this moment. Bobby lets all the remaining feeling drain from him until he has nothing left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After this outburst, he is exhausted. He calms, breathing heavily. A beat; he puts his bloodied hand to his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PRELAP the SOUND of a PHONE RINGING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noisy Queens place, its blue collar patrons watching boxing on the television and cheering. PAN OVER TO: one o those old, in-the-wall phone booths, with a sliding door. Bobby is on the phone, seated in the dark space. Holds a GLASS half-full of LIQUOR. Distraught, he listens for an answer as the PHONE RINGS once more. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BEAT.   Bobby collects himself.    Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY!!!!   Bobkes!!! How you doin'?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. Listen uh, you ain't spoke to Rosario lately, have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She's holed up with you, ain't she?--God knows where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--it's just, she   must've gone out for a little bit   and...I wanted to get in touch with   her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I talk to her, I'll tell her you called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... You know, things are really changing on my end. I ain't gonna be in protection anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Bob! That's great! Whaddaya say we knock back a few in your Dad's memory tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I, I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! El Caribe's got their masquerade party--every third drink's free. Be like old times!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there--what more could ask for! C'mon! You comin'? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be a man or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE on BOBBY as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOW is about to go on. The place has a darker quality to it now, and many patrons are wearing HALLOWEEN MASKS. BOBBY ENTERS, approaches a table in the back, where seate are Louis and Louis' girlfriend, HAZEL. Lou is armed with a huge grin, and he stands and hugs Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother!   The Grand Return!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they sit, Lou notices Bobby is alone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't heard from Rosario yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moves closer) You want Hazel here to fix you up with a little something? I'm only kiddin'--let's have a drink-- (to a waitress) Hey Natasha, over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you slow down a little? You're already acting stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're already acting like a pain in my ass! I can hold my liquor and yours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumbo, I don't want nothing right now--don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUST THEN, THE HOUSE LIGHTS DIM.    A SPOTLIGHT on the ST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARAT BUZHAYEV ambles up to the microphone with some difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. My name is Marat Buzhayev, and I'm the owner of the El Caribe. We have a special night, tonight--the Odessa Dance Troop is here to perform for us. I know you'll enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE.    Marat holds up his hands to quiet the clappi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We also have an old friend who's come back to us--I want him to stand--Bobby? Ladies and gentlemen, Bobby Green, who used to be our manager here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE APPLAUSE. THE SPOTLIGHT swings to Bobby, who stands briefly, sheepishly. Marat waves to him, Bobby nods, sits The SPOTLIGHT swings back to Marat who finishes up his introduction ("Enjoy the show!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.") and exits to still more applause. ELI MIRICHENKO, Marat's son-in-law, approaches Bobby. In his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father-in-law would love it if you come upstairs later, to say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Eli.   Tell him I'll come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli nods, exits.   Beat.   Then, sensing Bobby's mood:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates; then) Rosario--Rosario's gone down to Florida for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florida?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she probably just needed a little time for herself. She'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (more interior) You know, I was just thinking `bout when I first met her here... Working back there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, don't worry, Bob. I have no doubt she'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis turns to watch the show for a beat, takes a huge sw of his DRINK. Then turns AROUND AGAIN; close to Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, between you and me, that place they had you in was drivin' her crazy. The Kew Motor Inn--we used to call that the SCREW Motor Inn, with all the hookers... (back to Hazel) Get that waitress wouldja?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis turns back to the show. The camera moves into a CLOSE SHOT on BOBBY as Louis' words FREEZE him. He seems ready to EXPLODE. Then, finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis--? (Lou turns to him) How'd you know where I was staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know where I was staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was, it was in the papers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gets up with astonishing speed and moves right next to Louis. He grabs his arm tightly and, in his ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't in no papers, Louis. Don't make me embarrass you. Let's go outside, right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera MOVES INTO a CLOSE SHOT on LOUIS as he FRETS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still grabbing Louis's arm, Bobby wrenches him loose. Louis stumbles and falls to the asphalt. Bobby steps FORWARD. Something is different about him now. He is colder than ice, his eyes black saucers of rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Nezhinski?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play games with me, Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't kn--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just said, DO NOT PLAY GAMES WITH ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosario tol' you where we were staying, didn't she?!? She trusted you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis begins to crack.   Tears come to his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, we're, we're buddies--we're like brothers! C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mean nothing to me now-- that part of my life is dead. (beat; for himself) Today it ended for good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby I swear--I don't know nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my father is dead because of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis begins to sob quietly, shivering. He brings his han to his mouth. Bobby takes a threatening step forward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm on the Force now? And I could do anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis' eyes widen.    He holds out his hands defensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait! Bob, please! (beat; weakening) Don't do this to me... (even softer) Don't do this to me Bob, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me what you know right now or I swear to Christ I will make you disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis is crying loudly, like a ten year-old. He falls to his knees. Shivering in fear, he moves to Bobby's feet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, I... I told `em where you were--but, but it ain't what you think! I was makin' a buy and these guys in hoods, they held a gun to my head--so I tried to give `em the wrong information!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby clenches his fist.    Louis grabs onto him again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait, listen! It's true! Rosario tol' me you moved every couple days, she said you was gonna move--I thought you'd be gone by then! It's the truth, Bobby! I would never try and hurt you! Never, swear to God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stares at him for a moment, then his teeth grit. He tries to calm himself but cannot. With a ferocity, he unleashes a brutal punch across Louis' face with the brun of his fist. Louis collapses. In Louis' ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me, right now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your fuckin' spot?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA DOLLIES past A SHOOTING GALLERY. ADDICTS, thei inert bodies both crumpled and standing in virtual trance wander an ALLEYWAY. They RECOIL from CAR HEADLIGHTS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An American sedan, a DARK BLUE car, pulls up to the building. A man gets out--we can't quite tell who it is yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young AFRICAN-AMERICAN MALE stands in a doorway, dresse in a green parka. The hall, covered with trash and graffiti, is illuminated by a solitary light bulb. He guards ANOTHER SHOOTING GALLERY, which is in the room rig behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOOTSTEPS. The AFRICAN-AMERICAN MALE is on guard. The MAN emerges from the darkness, his back STILL TO US. Upon seeing him, the African-American Man smiles, reaches into his pocket. Hands the unseen man a small yellow envelope:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your money man, but my shit's running low. When you get me more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he counts the $) Just hold on a little while longer-- we get more for you soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?   When's that gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT TO the over-the-shoulder of the man, and leaning o of the DARKNESS and into the LIGHT: ELI MIRICHENKO, Marat son-in-law. He continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After tomorrow, everybody's gonna get well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The African-American Man nods. Satisfied with the cash, Eli turns around, walks back down the hallway. ANGLE BACK ON AFRICAN-AMERICAN MAN as the camera zooms past him, int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, among the addicts: BOBBY GREEN. His face illuminated only by the sliver of light from the crack in the door. He's witnessed the whole thing... We HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got your boy Eli completely covered, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is all together. Cops we don't know pack the room, standing around the table. Seated at the table: Michael, Jack, Bobby, and at the head, Joseph. A TOUGH- LOOKING COP we've seen before but not met:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just turned in for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't move an inch without us up his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he said tomorrow and that's what matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we'll be right there with him-- you can be sure of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're movin' serious weight, we might be talkin' major league firepower. Maybe we call in the Feds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Feds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each one of `em's got 25 years on the job with this kinda thing, Pudge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got one year of experience, repeated 25 times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYONE LAUGHS.     Bobby turns to Joseph:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop would never bring `em in, Joe. We gotta see this through ourselves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph's back stiffens.       With resolve:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, definitely... We'll get the TAC plan together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And wherever it is, we'll be ready for `em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arright, guys.    That's it for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The troops get up to leave.      Jack approaches Joseph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks at Jack--who leans in, to Joseph's ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, they're laughin' at us, out there on the street. Now when we get there, it'll be up to you what we do. But I hope you think about droppin' the hammer on `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph contemplates this briefly, then Jack pulls him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean--after your father and everything? These people're like fuckin' lice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just think about what I'm saying to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby senses the pressure being placed upon his brother, and he moves Jack away from Joseph:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, c'mon. Enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON BOBBY, JOSEPH as we GO TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERIES OF SHOTS of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1. WIDE SHOT of A MARSH AREA, with tall wheatlike weed growth that is extremely dense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2. MEDIUM SHOT of a STRUCTURE, in the middle of this. An old, small, abandoned stone building, built as a WPA project in the 1930's. It is a men's/ladies' bathroom, probably a Robert Moses project, but long since abandoned

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3. WIDE SHOT of the STRUCTURE. The CAMERA BOOMS DOWN, fro high above the STONE BUILDING, and PANS to REVEAL the TAL WEEDS AROUND IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4. MEDIUM SHOT of ELI'S DARK BLUE AUTOMOBILE, arriving. Eli emerges from the car. A bodyguard behind him, armed with an AK-47. He prepares to GREET:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out steps: A HOST of men in suits, grasping suitcases-- presumably filled with money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEN ANOTHER TOWN CAR.    And yet ANOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men all congregate like it's a legal business transaction. HANDSHAKES, SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN AROUND, MOVING THROUGH THE WEEDS NOW. And we SEE: Bobby and Joseph, as they arrive, MOVE INTO POSITION. The camera MOVES LATERALLY and we SEE: Michael and Jack and other COPS, doing much the same. All carrying SHOTGUNS. One COP POINTS A SHOTGUN MICROPHONE at the ACTIVITY, and our guys can HEAR perp conversations in their EARPIECES..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER CAR ARRIVES. APPEARING out of it is VADIM NEZHINSKI. Joseph bristles at the sight of him. Bobby grabs his brother's arm, squeezes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna get all of `em today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUST AT THAT MOMENT, a WHITE VAN PULLS UP: two men get ou They open the back, FILLED WITH FURS. They take a number of coats out of the BACK OF THE VAN, bring them to the shack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL THE COPS appear confused. What the hell is this? ANOTHER TOWN CAR. A CROWD OF PEOPLE stand around the auto Helping someone out of the vehicle. Whoever this is, he's the EMPEROR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMERGING: MARAT BUZHAYEV. Stepping up behind him, Eli, helping King Marat. MARAT and VADIM greet each other. They KISS WARMLY. ANGLE ON BOBBY. A beat. We SEE the devastation. Almost to himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookit the two of them...they're so fuckin' close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the cops spot: TWO YOUNG GRANDCHILDREN, sitting in t back of the car. They do not get out. They seem clueless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STANDING GUARD over all of this is a LOOKOUT, who is arme with an AK-47. Several other ARMED MEN take positions closer to the structure as the FURS ARE BROUGHT IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUSINESSMEN make some banter, then enter the shack--led b NEZHINSKI. MARAT BUZHAYEV and ELI follow him in. Many other men pour into the structure, BRIEFCASES in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay--when they complete the sale, that's when we move. ESU'll grab the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRANSACTION BEGINS inside the shack, and the COPS are WATCHING. They SEE the action through BROKEN WINDOWS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEZHINSKI and MARAT, with the Businessmen. He looks behin him, to MARAT, who steps forward. In Russian:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This's what we've been planning for for so long. My nephew has stayed just to see this through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this is done, we'll control almost the whole market. (motions to Man) Each load is completely untraceable. It's my own method.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man places a FUR on a distressed countertop.    Rips apart. Nezhinski steps forward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the product is in the van--total weight, 75 kilos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Places one of the lengths of fur into: A BASIN filled wit fluid... The CAMERA ZOOMS into A CLOSE SHOT on the FUR in that basin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FUR IS POKED a COUPLE OF TIMES. A beat. Then: WHITE PLUMES RISE from the coat's fabric to the top of the liquid, and Eli begins to skim the substance off the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUMPING OUT   some of the substance (now in crystalline f onto a pad,   MARAT BUZHAYEV hands it to a BUSINESSMAN, w TASTES it.    THE BUSINESSMAN nods, pleased with his product...    He reaches for a SUITCASE. It is OPENED. Filled with   MONEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Joseph.    Joseph has his earpiece, HEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deal's closing--let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gets up, out of the weeds, SHOTGUN aimed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're surrounded by the police! Come out now, with your hands on your heads!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim and Marat SNAP TO ATTENTION. SHOCKED. RUSSIAN WORDS ARE EXCHANGED, and everyone starts to PANIC...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COPS begin the assault, EXPLODING FROM EVERYWHERE. SIRENS, the whole thing. Bobby and Joseph get up, stand into a crouch and move slowly toward the structure. A GRO OF ESU COPS charge MARAT'S CAR, GOING FOR THE CHILDREN--w watch this with fear and incomprehension...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ARMED GUARD, standing outside the shack, begins to fir at the cops. EVERYONE OPENS FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL OF A SUDDEN: A COP, that TOUGH-LOOKING COP we saw at Joseph's house but a few moments earlier, is HIT by the Armed Guard's fire. HIT IN THE FACE, he falls down near Joseph and Bobby. DEAD, his visage a bloodied pulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT ON JOSEPH. HE FREEZES. We momentarily FLASH CUT back to his OWN SHOOTING... He cannot bear reliving the terror of his moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the COPS move in: Bobby spins around to look for his brother. He finds him still on the ground. Joseph seems unable to move, holding onto his shotgun for dear life:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph looks at his brother, shakes his head. Completely shattered in the moment. STILL. SHOTS RING OUT. Bobby pushes his brother down on the ground. In his ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arright, just stay down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos begins. All of the men inside the small building have aimed their guns into the WEEDS. But instead of stopping because of the shooting, Bobby progresses inexorably toward the structure, his shotgun poised to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW MICHAEL and JACK and OTHER MEMBERS of the NARCOTICS TEAMS come out of the WEEDS. THEY FIRE their WEAPONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARAT'S GRANDCHILDREN are DRAGGED OUT OF THE CAR, CRYING LOUDLY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LINE of UNIFORMED POLICE OFFICERS forms. They move in unison. Seems like a hundred men. Bobby and Jack and some of his men are coming from one side, the line from anothe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS. A GUN BATTLE. The LOOKOUT with the AK-47 is hit-- fatally. Bobby SEES several people FLEEING out a back entrance toward another section of the weeds. Joseph remains in the grass, his head down, his hands on his hea We cannot SEE his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim Nezhinski is frazzled by the approaching FORCE he sees through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving with tremendous speed, he begins to light the FURS on FIRE... SMOKE... Vadim BEGINS TO COUGH, taking a suitcase of money with him. He backs out of the STRUCTURE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILIOUS CLOUDS OF SMOKE.     BOBBY is MOVING TOWARD THE BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: VADIM SCURRIES INTO THE WEEDS... THE SMALL STRUCTURE
dialogues.text: REALLY STARTS TO BURN. It is an odd flame, BLUE and SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY RUNS OFF, into THE WEEDS, following VADIM. ELI CHARGES TOWARD HIS CAR. JACK is RIGHT BEHIND HIM:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!   Halt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack ruthlessly pumps Eli full of bullets, and the man falls down dead. Jack approaches, mercilessly FIRES ANOTHER SHOT into the corpse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WIND HOWLS... Tall, tawny-colored weeds, marsh. BOBBY moves through the DENSE WEED GROWTH. Pushing his way through the brown plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR POLICE DOGS. BOBBY starts THRASHING. The CAMERA is HAND-HELD, MOVING TO AND FRO WITH FEROCIOUS and VERTIGINOUS SPEED. ANGLE ON BOBBY as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Bobby, SEEING, through the WET GLASS: BURT, AS HE I SHOT. DURING THE CHASE IN THE RAIN. We GO BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby raises his shotgun as he RACES THROUGH THE PHRAGMIT GRASS. The WEEDS PART. It is TRICKY. HEAVY BREATHING. BOBBY SEES other MEN running through the weeds, but he can't tell who's who. CONFUSION...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY'S HEARTBEAT THUMPS ON THE SOUNDTRACK... A MAN
dialogues.text: backing up toward him; each man has his back to the other...

dialogues.speaker: INTO BOBBY, WITH THE FIGURE BEHIND HIM. BOBBY SEES THE
dialogues.text: SHADOW ON THE GROUND. He turns, SLOWLY...raises his weapon, about to FIRE when he realizes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's MICHAEL SOLO, who, in profile to Bobby is unaware he almost been killed. He stops when he feels the barrel of Bobby's shotgun against his ribs. SLOWLY TURNING AROUND, he sees BOBBY. WHISPERED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This's too dangerous. We'll all wind up killing each other--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vadim is in here with us. Radio our guys, tell `em to get into the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL OF A SUDDEN, we HEAR, SHOUTED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby!   We got the old man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks at Michael, points to his earpiece. Michael nods, and as we HEAR Mike's words into his radio ("Our guys, outta the brush!") Bobby starts to back up, toward the clearing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is greeted by the boys. Other POLICE, including Michael Solo, emerge from the weeds, quietly. Jack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the old man--Buzhayev. Up by the cars. His grandkids are safe--they're in the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby acknowledges this, turns to another OFFICER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are all our guys out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer looks, counts.     Then nods.   Bobby looks t the weeds and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the officers back up--all of them except Bobby. Who stands, shotgun in hand, waiting for VADIM NEZHINSKI to emerge from the now-burning brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO OTHER MEN come out of the fire, coughing. They are carrying their guns and thus killed by POLICE GUNFIRE. NO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby?   What're you doin'--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna let him get away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS the other POLICE panic around him, Bobby ENTERS THE FIRE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby walks through the FLAME. It is OTHERWORLDLY. The ORANGE-BLUE, the SMOKE, it all seems to blow from left to right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAOS of HEAT, SMOKE... We HEAR ONLY THE RUSHING WIND... BOBBY seems INCONCEIVABLY DRIVEN. Methodically stepping forward, past the FIRES, PEERING THROUGH SMOKE. NOTHING.. JUST TUFTS OF SMOKE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he spots an area in which the SMOKE FLOWS UNNATURALL AGAINST THE BREEZE, as though it SURGES AROUND SOMETHING. SOMETHING COVERED IN SMOKE, STANDING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within what seems like a split second, Bobby raises his SHOTGUN and FIRES it. VADIM CRUMPLES TO THE GROUND. A DIRECT HIT to the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby lifts his shotgun and approaches. The weeds separate, REVEALING NEZHINSKI, with a look on his face th registers a kind of shock, a shock that he's been hit. Nezhinski sees Bobby standing over him. With all the energy he has in the world:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't...don't let me die in here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stands over him for a BEAT. Then Bobby turns his back on Vadim, walks through the fires around him. As Vadim calls after him ("BOBBY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLEASE, DON'T LEAVE ME HERE!"), the flames begin to engul the area where Nezhinski lies...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY EMERGES FROM THE FIRE... HE WALKS TOWARD THE PO
dialogues.text: CARS. THE POLICE ARE ASSEMBLED     around: MARAT BUZHAYEV BOBBY WATCHES HIM FOR A MOMENT,    HIS FACE filled with CONTROLLED RAGE. BEAT. EACH MAN    STARES AT EACH OTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby--I, I didn't know it would be your family--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY TAKES A THREATENING STEP FORWARD. Bobby's expressio seems unmatched in its ferocity; Marat sees in Bobby's ey a horrible determination, begins to cry... Bobby's emotions are a CAULDRON:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down!   On the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marat gets on his knees. WHIMPERING. Bobby puts Marat's hands on his head, starts PATTING HIM DOWN. CLEAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY PUTS THE SHOTGUN AT MARAT'S TEMPLE.    We HEAR the DOGS, the FIRE, the WIND, the SIRENS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police see the unforgiving expression on Bobby's face and the reality of the old man in front of them. Bobby turns to the others, particularly JACK. He looks at him, dark-eyed. Then he turns away and starts walking, making eye contact with none of them. He utters a command, to al of them and none of them in particular:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him in the fuckin' van... Don't touch him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby walks past the small building, which CONTINUES TO BURN SILENTLY--with that eerie BLUE FLAME... Other cops watch him with awe and respect. They back away from him. He proceeds on toward the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE SEES: Joseph inside one of them, still. Staring at him WE DOLLY WITH HIM as he moves to his brother. CROUCHES DOWN, stays by JOSEPH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUNDREDS OF POLICE OFFICERS, all dressed up to the nines, are HERE. White gloves and all. Milling about in a white plaster walled room. Upbeat chatter. Then: Bobby emerges through the DOORS in his DRESS BLUES. Upon seeing him, th others smile, CHEER. People touch him, shake his hand. Eye him with respect. AD-LIB GREETINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby! Hey! Lookit you--six months in the Academy and already you look like a chief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey everybody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby moves toward the AUDITORIUM DOORS.   Now Michael approaches. In Bobby's ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saw the commissioner. A lotta people're gonna wanna talk to you--important people. About maybe settin' you up with your own unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.   We'll talk about that after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sees: JOSEPH, STANDING nearby with his hand on his child's shoulder, the rest of his FAMILY SURROUNDING HIM. The brothers embrace. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're getting started--we should probably go in now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceremony is getting underway. As Bobby and Joseph mov past the seated crowd toward their chairs in front:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I think Pop would be real happy to see you like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slight ironic laugh) I don't think he'd believe it... But I guess things don't always go the way you think they will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the Force'll treat you good. I'm sure you do very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You definitely gonna leave? Ain't no way you change your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head; then:) It's the right thing. It's over for me--I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, we'll spend some more time together from now on. Okay? I'll come over next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arright, yeah.    Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby approaches the POLICE CHAPLAIN, hands him a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaplain? I'd like you to introduce me this way. If you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHAPLAIN looks at the paper, nods. He then walks to the podium. Bobby sits as the Chaplain begins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen: we shall begin today's ceremony with the traditional invocation, moving then to the valedictorian address to be given by...Robert Grusinsky. Son of the late Deputy Chief Albert Grusinsky, brother of Captain Joseph Grusinsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON BOBBY as his REAL NAME is SPOKEN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, as I look at this fine young man seated here, I can't help but think about all the young members of our department. I get filled with such pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men like him are the great future of our Force...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the man speaks, Bobby SCANS the room. HE SEES ROSARIO, standing in the crowd behind the seated audience. Her fac is partially obscured. BOBBY CANNOT BELIEVE THE FLOOD OF EMOTION that overwhelms him, the happiness he feels upon catching a glimpse of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But just as quickly as this thrill grabs him, it disappea when she becomes completely visible; for he realizes that IT IS NOT HER but rather a young woman who bears merely a faint resemblance... Joseph interrupts this, leans over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to reality) Love you too, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police line up on the stage. Everyone's seated, Bobby and Joseph in front. The POLICE BAND begins to play the drums Bobby straightens up, raises his hand--along with the sea of blue--in a SALUTE as the flag is carried to the front.
